Нусрат более двенадцати лет занимается животноводством. Он разводит мелко - рогатый и крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Нусрат разводит скот у себя дома. На сегодняшний день у него 10 голов крупнорогатого и 12 голов мелко - рогатого скота. В продвижении его дела ему помогают его дети. 
Нусрат 47 летний женатый мужчина. У него семеро детей. Двое его сыновей находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. 
Нусрат берет кредит для закупа бычков и быков.
texts.en:
Nurat has worked in animal husbandry for more than 12 years. He raises sheep, goats, and cattle for future sale on his property. He currently has 10 goats and sheep as well as 10 heads of cattle. 

Nurat is a 47-year-old married man with seven children. His children help him with his work. Though, two of his sons work in the Russian Federation. He would like this loan to purchase steer and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase steer and bulls

loans.name: Akzyinat

texts.ru: Акзыйнат 40 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей . Акзыйнат в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 8 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством. Начатый с суммы 5,000 KGS бизнес благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости Акзыйнат, на сегодня насчитывает 2 доеные коровы, 2 теленка, 30 голов овец и коз, 1 лошадь и приносит доход около 5,000 сом в месяц с продажи молочных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Акзыйнат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку доеных коров. Что позволит увеличить продажи молока. Доходы от кредита Иззатой планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса  и как поделилась она планирует купить машину.
texts.en:
Akzyinet is a 40-year-old married mother of five. As her family's main income provider, Akzyinet began working in animal husbandry eight years ago. She began her business with 5,000 som and thanks to hard work and persistence, today she owns two dairy cows, two calves, 30 sheep and goats, and one horse. Her dairy sales bring in about 5,000 som a month. 

With long-term business development in mind, Akzyinet turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som to purchase two dairy cows. The addition of these cows would increase her milk sales. She plans to invest the income from the loan in her business and to purchase a car.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Umedi

texts.ru: Умед проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 24 года. Он холост. Живет вместе с отцом. Отец Умеда работает таксистом. Умед сам занимается скотоводством. Он уже пять лет как разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Умед берет кредит для закупа бычков с целью увеличения поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Umedi lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 24 years old and single. He lives with his father, who is a taxi driver. 

Umedi works in animal husbandry. He has been raising cattle for future sale for five years now. He would like this loan to purchase steer with the goal of increasing his head of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which has a high regional output of maize. He has one child.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for four years. His primary income sources are eggs and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping!" His biggest challenge is "Expensive poultry feeds and poultry diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Maua." He will use the loan to buy more poultry birds.

Jeremiah was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "Because Juhudi Kilimo offers loans for small scale farmers to improve their lives."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "They are short-term loans given to small-scale farmers and businesses by financial institutions."

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Jeremiah replied, "Money from the poultry and its products will help to gather for family expenses."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jeremiah owns the following: poultry, bicycle, motorcycle, but does not own cow, pig, pump or automobile. 

Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net and TV but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has three children.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for six years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Gardening!" His biggest challenge is "transporting produce to the market." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "white udder."

He will use the loan to buy materials for setting up a greenhouse, mainly for growing tomatoes.

Samwel was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "Because of the efficiency in loan disbursements." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "How to do farming as a business."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit his family, Samwel replied, "Improved quality of life."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Samwel owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle, but does not own pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter lives in the Kitale area of Kenya, which lies in the northern part of the Rift Valley. He has three children.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and transportation services.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry keeping and dairy farming!" His biggest challenge is "diseases." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Mrembo and Maua."

He will use the loan requested from Juhudi Kilimo amounting to 60,000 KES to buy poultry birds.

Peter was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "It finances farmers with assets for them to get income and improve their standards of living." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: "They are loans given to small-scale farmers and businessmen."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked  how this loan would benefit his family, Peter replied, "My children will get education."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Peter owns the following: cow, poultry, bicycle, motorcycle, but does not own pig, pump, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, TV, DVD but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Vitalis

texts.en:
Vitalis is a 50-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 3 years to 11 years. He describes himself as a hardworking man. 

He operates a photography business where he takes photographs and sells them to customers. His business is located at a viable location and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. 

He will use the KES 5,800 loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 50,000 he managed to pay.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as ambitious. 

He operates a Nissan with which he provides transport to passengers and businesspeople. His business is located at a viable location and his primary customers are local residents. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 32,700 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by his eight family members. 

His business goal is to run a new business of rental houses within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous one of KES 70,000 he managed to pay well.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has four children.

He is a farmer and has been doing this work for seven years. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Poultry!" His biggest challenge is "cost of poultry feeds." The animals in the farm are not named.

He will use the loan to buy poultry birds.

Stephen was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: "fair interest rates."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Business record keeping."

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Stephen replied, "Children will go to better schools."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Stephen owns the following: cow, poultry, but does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as a principled man. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, home products, maize flour, cooking fat, etc. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His business is located at a strategic business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as stiff competition within the area. 

He will use the KES 12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by his family members. 

His business goal is to expand his business to a wholesale/retail store within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy land for his family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Zuwela

texts.en:
Zuwela is 24 years old and married with three children. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Zuwela operates a timber-selling business which is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. Her major business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Zuwela is requesting a 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her family. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is a 28 year old married woman and a mother of four young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. 

She has been in the seaweed farming business for more than two years now, together with her husband.
 
Annaly is asking for a loan to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope, straw and others. With this, she will be able to increase their seaweed farming.

In the future, Annaly hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming such as seaweed seedlings, rope and straw.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 66-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 19 years to 33 years. She describes herself as determined and ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells clothes and shoes. Her business is located at a viable location and her primary customers are local residents. In addition, Ruth sells vegetables and fruits, which increases her business income. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 15,600 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her seven family members. 

Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Bonface

texts.en:
Bonface is 31 years and married with three children whose ages range from three to seven. For the past 13 years, he has been a farmer who sells his produce and he also works as a mason. Bonface's business is located in a strategic area and his primary customers are local residents. His biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve his business. 

Bonface is requesting a 12,900 KES loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by his family members . His business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Bephley

texts.en:
Bephley is 33 years old and married with four children whose ages range from three to 13. She describes herself as optimistic. Bephley operates a business where she provides maize grinding services and sells maize flour. Her business is located in a strategic business area and her primary customers are local residents. Bephley's biggest business challenge is insufficient funds to improve her business. 

Bephley is requesting a 5,800 KES loan to buy a solar lamp that will be used by her six family members. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp

loans.name: Ferahim

texts.en: Ferahim is 22 years old. Ferahim lives in the Fizuli region with his parents, but he was an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) person from Fizuli town. Now Ferahim needs 1,800 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy spare parts for his work, so he can do innovation in his work. He loves his work. It was a new business for Ferahim. He needs loan to improve business and to get more products for his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 53 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 30 and 25. In 2000, she established her woodcarving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid seven loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timber. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy wood for her woodcarving business.

loans.name: Phillip & Josius

texts.en:
Phillip is a 50-year-old man who lives in rural western Uganda. He, his wife and his eight children spend their time farming to meet their many family needs and improve their standard of living.

Phillip is borrowing with his son Josius so that he can buy a piece of land for him on which he will start cultivating his own coffee to earn a living and support his own young family. He has a wife and a son, and the father feels it's time for him to become independent, yet the family land is too small to support all the eight children in addition to his son's family. 

Phillip is a hardworking man, though constrained because of the large family. In the photo is Phillip and his son Josius who are borrowing jointly; they will pay the loan together.

loans.use: To buy land for Josius to begin his own coffee farm.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a 39-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells firewood and cereals. Her business is located at a strategic business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

She will use the 5,800 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a solar lamp, which will be used by her family members for lighting the house during the night. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 6. In 2000, she established her woodcarving business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy wood and timber. In the future, Laxmi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts. Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity. Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills. Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand tool finishing. In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone. With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume. This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buys wood for her business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 42-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be a focused and hardworking woman. She operates a retail business where she sells maize flour that she grinds. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to improve the business. 

She will use the 21,000 Kes (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William, who lives in rural Lyantonde, buys baby goats from his fellow farmers, especially when they have financial setbacks and want quick cash. He buys them at a fairly low price and feeds them until they are mature or when others have given birth so that he accumulates enough goats. Then he takes them to busy monthly markets where they are bought by farmers or those that take them for slaughter. 

Lack of enough capital, high transport costs to market centers and high taxes levied on goats are his biggest challenges. Pictured is William at his farm with some of the goats.

loans.use: To buy baby goats that he will feed and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is a shrewd and hardworking young man of 27 years. He started welding immediately after he dropped out of school five years ago due to lack of school fees, and helped fund school fees for his siblings, who were still in primary school. Through hard work, he has managed to educate two of his siblings and two relatives with whom he works at the welding workshop. 

He is building his first residential house, which will help him find enough space to live with his family as well as some relatives since it has been costly to rent. He commends Ugafode for the good job of helping the poor to also access loans, unlike in commercial banks, where the procedures are long and unfriendly. His previous loan was used on the same house, and he hopes that with this loan he will be able to complete it and move in with his family. 

In the photo is Rogers (left) with a Ugafode staff member who consented to be published.

loans.use: To finish construction of his house.

loans.name: Hilda Maria

texts.es:
Hilda originaria de Estelí, con 41 años de edad, acompañada, madre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 8, 12 y 16 años, de oficio comerciante. Se dedica al servicio de molino. Inicio con capital propio, productos de sus ahorros, el cual es el servicio de molino que  le ofrece a sus clientes, ya que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, y  este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliarlo, para darles mejor  atención  a sus clientes.
Hilda solicita el préstamo  para comprar otro molino. Ya que ella estima que le será de mucha ayuda porque asi podrá comprar  dos molino uno para moler masa y el otro para moler pinol (es una bebida típica que esta hecha a base de maíz), de esta manera le  podrá dar un mejor servicios a sus clientes, y asi incrementar sus ganancias. Sus  planes futuro  es hacerle mejora a su casa para tener mejor presentación en su negocio.
texts.en:
41-year old Hilda is a native of Estelí. She and her husband have three children aged 8, 12, and 16. Hilda is a businesswoman and runs a mill. She started out using her own savings. Her husband helps her with the business. This is her first business venture and she hopes to expand it so she can provide her customers with better service.

Hilda is seeking a loan to buy another mill; she believes it will be a great help. One mill will be used to grind corn and the other to grind pinol (to make a local drink based on corn). In this way she'll provide an improved service to her customers and increase her income. In the future she hopes to make improvements to her house which in turn will give a better impression of her business.

loans.use: Buy a second mill

loans.name: Eliecer

texts.es:
Eliecer originario de la Comarca San Nicolás, Municipio de Estelí, con 25 años, soltero, Estudiante universitario, de oficio comerciante. Inicio dando sus servicios de molino en la misma comunidad a sus clientes, ya que el dice que este ha sido un negocio familiar, el cual su padre le enseño, que ha venido de generación en generación, en el  cual el comenzó a trabajar a los 19 años de edad. Este ha sido su primer negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, para darles una mejor atención a sus clientes y poder satisfacer sus necesidades.
Eliecer solicita el préstamo para la compra de un motor  y un asiento, etc. El considera que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, para poder atender más clientes y asi brindar un mejor servicio, de esta manera obtener   mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Eliecer is originally from the town of Estelí in the Comarca San Nicolás.  He is 25 years old, single, a university student, and works as a trader.  He began offering his services to his customers in his community as a grinder.  He says this work is familiar to him since his father taught it to him and it has come down from generation to generation.  He started this work at 19 years old.  This is his first business.  He expects to expand the business, provide better service to his customers, and be able to satisfy his needs.   

Eliecer is requesting this loan to purchase a motor and a seat.  He believes this loan will help him serve more customers and provide better service to be able to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase a motor and a seat.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
José con 31 años de edad, casado, padre de 2 hijos, entre la edad de 1 y 3 años, de oficio comerciante.  El comenzó  trabajando para una empresa, la cual le dio un crédito para que estableciera su propio negocio como es la venta de ropa y zapatos ,del que es propietario hace mas de 3 años, el cual este ha sido su primer negocio ,con el que ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de su esposa.
José solicita el préstamo para comprar  mas ropa, zapato, etc. ya que el considera que este préstamo le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería necesaria que necesita en inventario para poder vender mas y asi incrementar sus ganancias en su negocio, sus planes futuro es comprar un carro para salir a vender en los mercados de la ciudad, ya que sus metas próxima es ampliar su negocio y asi obtener mejores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose, a 31 years old, married father of two children between the ages of one and three, is a merchant.  He started working for a company that gave him a loan to establish his own business selling clothes and shoes.  He has been a business owner for more than three years.  This has been his first business and, with it, he has been able to move forward, with help from his wife. 

Jose is requesting the loan to buy more clothes, shoes, etc. because the loan will help him buy all the necessary merchandise that he needs in inventory to be able to sell more and thus increase the profits from his business.  His future plan is to buy a car to go out to sell in the city’s markets because his next goal is to expand his business and thus obtain better income for the wellbeing of his family.

loans.use: to buy more clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Wilmer Isaac

texts.es:
Wilmer originario de Estelí, con 22 años de edad, casado, de oficio comerciante. Inicio sin ninguna experiencia  cortando pelo a los jóvenes, pero con el tiempo le fue gustando este tipo de oficio y fue cuando decidió poner su propio negocio de barbería, el cual este ha sido su primer negocio, el cuenta con el apoyo de su papa, ya que sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio, para incrementar sus ganancias.
Wilmer solicita el crédito para comprar una silla de barbería, pistolas y planchas de cabello etc. Esto le ayudara a  instalar un salón de belleza. Ya que el considera que este préstamo le será de mucha ayuda, porque asi podrá surtir su barbería  con artículos de belleza,  que necesite en su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias, sus planes futuro es tener una casa propia  y establecer  otro negocio
texts.en:
Wilmer is originally from Estelí.  He is 22 years old and married.  He started with no experience cutting young people's hair, but in time he found he liked the work and decided to open his own barber shop.  It is his first business.  He has support from his father and hopes to expand his business to increase his income.  

Wilmer is requesting this loan to purchase a barber's chair, hair dryers, and hair straighteners.  This will help him start his salon.  He thinks that this loan will help him stock his barber shop with beauty products that his business needs to increase his income.  His plan for the future is to have his own home and establish another business.

loans.use: to purchase a barber's chair, hair dryers, and hair straighteners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Venancio

texts.es:
Venancio tiene 31 años de edad, es conviviente y vive con su familia en una casa que no es propia.  Esta casa está ubicada en el distrito de Cayalti, a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la crianza y venta de animales menores, él cría los animales en algunos corrales acondicionados cerca a su domicilio. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Con estos ingresos se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia.

Venancio desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de aves de corral de modo que su nivel de ventas se pueda ampliar durante los siguientes meses en los cuales su demanda aumenta. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles.

Venancio es bastante empeñoso y con ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para poder consolidar a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Venancio is 31 years old, common law married and lives with his family in a house that is not his own. This house is located in the district of Cayalti, 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque.

He has earned a living for ten years by raising and selling small animals.  He raises the animals in some pens set up near his home.  When these animals have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the dealers that always visit the area where he lives.  With these earnings, he sees to the success of his family.  

Venancio wishes to expand his business with the purchase of poultry so that his level of sales can expand during the coming months when demand increases.  Thus he has seen fit to request a loan of 3000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  

Venancio is quite hard-working and he desires to get ahead.  His greatest desire is to continue growing as a business-owner in order strengthen his family.  The people that know him consider him a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy poultry for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 41 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos y vive con su familia en el distrito de Cayalti, ubicado a aproximadamente a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y venta de animales menores.  Los alimenta, los cría y engorda, y una vez que ya están en un peso y tamaño ideal los vende a los comerciantes y el mercado de la zona.  Herlinda junto con su esposo trabajan arduamente día a día para que con sus ingresos puedan darle lo mejor a su familia.  

Herlinda desea seguir crecienda.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.  Este dinero le permitirá comprar más animales para su posterior venta.

Herlinda cuenta con buenas referencias personales en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 41 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her family in the Cayalti district about one hour from the city of Chiclayo.  

She has worked raising and selling small animals for five years.  She feeds them so they grow and fatten, and when they are at the ideal weight and size, she sells them to merchants and at the market in her area.  Herlinda works hard every day together with her husband so that their income can give the best to their family.

Herlinda wants to continue growing, so she has decided to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This money will allow her to purchase more animals for later sale.  

Herlinda has good personal references from her community.

loans.use: to purchase animals for later sale.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 62 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos en la zona urbana marginal del distrito de Mórrope,   una zona rural que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra situada aproximadamente a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Cuenta con servicios de  luz, el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias.

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es la crianza y comercio de animales, contando con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 20 años, cliente cuenta con gran inventario en aves de corral, teniendo patos, pavos medianos y grandes y gallinas, las cuales son vendidas una vez engordados.

Víctor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.  El destino del crédito será para invertir en la puesta de techo de su casa y compra de alimento balanceado para su ganado.  

Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización
texts.en:
Victor is 62 years old, single and lives in his grandparents’ home in the marginal urban area in the district of Mórrope, which is a rural area that belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is situated approximately an hour from the city of Chiclayo. There is electricity, and it  is a small community with approximately 100 families.
Victor’s business is raising and selling animals. He has more than 20 years of experience. He has a large inventory of poultry, as he has ducks, medium and large turkeys, and chickens that he sells once they have been fattened.
Victor is requesting a loan of 1500 new Peruvian soles. The loan will be used to invest in putting a roof on his house and to purchase animal feed for his livestock.
This business has competition, but it also has a large market.

loans.use: to put a roof on his home and to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Jose Yvan

texts.es:
José tiene 22  años de edad, soltero, sin hijos. Vive en casa de abuelos propia en el Distrito de Tambogrande correspondiente al distrito a Piura ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Él ayuda en las tareas de la parcela y en la crianza de ovinos a sus abuelos. Comunidad alejada a unos  25 minutos de la ciudad y no cuenta con servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla el titular es el cultivo de limón y mango, así como también la crianza de ovinos, aves de corral. Se dedica al cultivo de limón y  a la crianza hace aproximadamente más de 2 años. Solicita crédito para el mantenimiento de cultivo y la compra de alimento balanceado para animales. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para el manejo de sus cultivos y a la adecuada alimentación de animales.

José desea seguir creciendo en el negocio además de ofrecer productos de calidad.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in his grandparents’ own house in the district of Tambogrande, which is in the province of Piura and located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo. He helps work the land and raise his grandparents’ sheep. The community is 25 minutes away from a city and does not have basic services.
His business is the cultivation of lemons and mangos, as well as raising sheep and poultry. He has been working in the production of lemons and in livestock for about 2 years. He is requesting the loan to maintain the crop and to buy feed for the animals. José has knowledge on crop management and the adequate feeding of animals.
José desires to continue growing in the business and, in addition, to offer quality products. This is why he thought it would be good to obtain a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to maintain his crop and to buy feed for his animals.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive en una comunidad en la zona urbana de Zaña, perteneciente a la provincia de Chiclayo.

Orlando se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros desde hace más de 5 años en su propio domicilio en base a pedidos.  Él compra sus telas al por mayor para que le den a buen precio.  Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en esta actividad, Orlando es muy conocida en el rubro y ya cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.  Con estos ingresos cubre sus gastos y los de su familia.

Orlando necesita comprar más telas para seguir confeccionando sus prendas de vestir para la venta.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Orlando es un joven empresario con muy buenas referencias personales.
texts.en:
Orlando is 26 years old, single and lives in a community in the urban area of Zaña, which is in the province of Chiclayo.
For over five years, Orlando has been making women’s and men’s clothing to order, based out of his own home. He buys his fabrics wholesale, so that they give him a good price. Due to the time he has spent working in this activity, Orlando is well-known in the area and has a group of loyal customers. With this income, he covers his expenses and those of his family.
Orlando needs to buy more fabrics to continue making his clothing for sale. This is why, in order to achieve his objective, he has requested a loan of 1000 new Peruvian soles.
Orlando is an entrepreneurial youth with lots of good personal references.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make clothes.

loans.name: Martas Group

texts.es: Doña Martha es miembro del Grupo Solidario Las Martas, tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera de cinco hijos, es una persona trabajadora, amigable y emprendedora. Ella inicio su negocio desde hace 15 años, se dedica a la venta de golosinas, negocio con el que pudo sacar adelante a sus hijos, se levanta a las 3:00 am a cocinar y sale a vender a las 9:00 am, el trabajo lo realiza todos los días y lo hace en conjunto con una de sus hijas, su principal desafío es salir a vender cuando esta lloviendo ya que ella no cuenta con un medio de transporte y los problemas del clima le afectan en las ventas diarias. Con el préstamo que doña Martha solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: harina, pollo, maíz tierno y seco, para poder cocinar sus golosinas. Con la ayuda de este préstamo ella podrá ofrecer mas golosinas a sus clientes y de esta forma tendrá mayores ventas y mejores ganancias que le ayuden al sustento de su familia. Su sueño es tener su propio local para ya no salir a vender de forma ambulante y que su negocio pueda estar ubicado en el centro de la ciudad para poder ahorrar cuando ella ya no pueda trabajar y así tener una vejez tranquila. Doña Martha es el segundo crédito que solicita en FAMA y ha pagado satisfactoriamente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the united group Las Martas.  She is 47 years old and is a single mother of five children.  She is a hard-working, friendly and entrepreneurial person.  She started her business 15 years ago.  She earns a living selling snacks, a business with which she can help her children get ahead.  She gets up at 3:00 a.m. to cook and at 9:00 a.m. she goes out to sell.  She works everyday and does it with one of her daughters.  Her main challenge is to go out to sell when it is raining since she does not have a means of transportation and problems with the weather affect her daily sales.  

With the loan Martha is requesting, she needs it to invest in the purchase of products such as flour, chicken, and corn (fresh and dried) in order to cook her snacks.  With the help of this loan, she will be able to offer more snacks to her customers and in this way she will have greater sales and better profits which will help her to support her family.  

Her dream is to have her own shop and not go out to do mobile sales and to be able to have her business located in the center of the city so that she can save for when she is no longer able to work and thus have a peaceful retirement.  Martha is the second loan requested from FAMA and they have satisfactorily made the payments [on the first one].

loans.use: to buy flour, chicken, and corn among other things.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comite Nuevo Horizonte es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, son 17 integrantes muy responsables, que se esfuerzan por poder cumplir con todos sus compromisos. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que día a día dan todo por sus familias.
Maria Cresencia vende carbón, y ella comenta que cada vez le está yendo mejor, pues la venta de carbón cada vez sube más, ya que es más barata. Maria Cresencia es una persona muy emprendedora, que desde siempre se ha esforzado por salir adelante y ayudar a los suyos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de carbón, con lo cual podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes y teniendo surtido su negocio. Ella agradece por la gran oportunidad que estan recibiendo pues no solo ellas se ven beneficiadas, sino también sus familias.
texts.en:
The committee named “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) is in the city of San Lorenzo. This group has 17 responsible members who strive to fulfill all of their commitments. They are female heads of households and strive to provide everything for their families on a daily basis.

Maria Cresencia sells charcoal. She says that her business is doing much better each time because her sales increase as the price of charcoal goes lower. Maria Cresencia is an enterprising individual who always strives to move forward and help her family members. She is requesting a loan in order to buy charcoal so that she can complete her customers’ orders and stock her business.

Maria Cresencia is grateful for this wonderful opportunity that her group has received. Not only will the members benefit, but their families will also enjoy the results.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: José Manuel tiene la edad de 29 años, estudia la carrera de contabilidad pública y finanzas, empezó a trabajar a los 12 años, en la actualidad se desempeña como asistente en la facultad de administración en una universidad, con su salario cubre con sus gastos de estudios ya que su profesión es algo que a él le gusta mucho y es muy importante  culminarlos para poder aspirar a un mejor puesto laboral, por esta razón José solicita apoyo de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera, ya que con su sueldo no le da para cubrir este gasto de una sola vez.
texts.en: José Manuel is 29 years old and is studying for a degree in public accounting and finance. He started working at age 12. He is currently working as an assistant in the administration department in a university. With his salary, he pays the costs of his studies since his profession is something that he likes a lot, and it is very important to finish his studies to be able to aspire to a better job. This is why José is requesting the support of a loan to be able to pay for a course towards his degree, since his salary is not enough to cover this expense in one lump sum.

loans.use: to pay for a course towards his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the for licensing and registration requirements.

loans.name: Luis Leonidas

texts.es: Don Leónidas tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos, ellos residen en la comunidad de Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho. Su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y también le ayuda a su esposo en la finca de café, don Leónidas vivía en la zona del Paraíso solo venia por la temporada a cortar café y poco a poco se fue familiarizando y le fue gustando todo lo que tenia que ver con la caficultura ya que desde hace 10 años empezó cultivando su finca y hoy en día tiene a su familia reunida y tiene su propio cafetal, ya que junto con sus hijos y su esposa sacan la cosecha y cortan el café. El horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am a  2:00 de la tarde. La ventaja que tiene don Leónidas es que el café esta a buen precio y tiene mucha demanda. El préstamo que don Leónidas esta solicitando lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra. El único desafío que se le presentan son las diferentes plagas que dañan el café por lo que tiene que controlarlas.  Su meta es que sus hijos puedan estudiar y que se hagan profesionales, también poder tener una finca más grande. Es el segundo financiamiento que don Leónidas solicita en FAMA y hasta el momento ha cancelado sus cuotas de forma puntual.
texts.en: Leónidas is 48 years old, married and has three children. They live in the community of Miraflores, Patuca, Olancho. His wife takes care of the domestic chores and also helps her husband on the coffee farm. Leónidas lived in the Paraíso area and would only come for the season to cut coffee and, little by little, he became familiar with it and to like everything that had to do with coffee growing. For more than 10 years now he has been cultivating his farm and today has his family reunited and has his own coffee plantation. Together with his children and his wife, they harvest and cut the coffee. The working hours are from 6am to 2pm. The advantage that Leónidas has is that the coffee is at a good price and has a high demand. Leónidas needs the loan that he is requesting to invest in the purchase of fertilizers and to hire labor. The only challenge that he faces are the different pests that harm the coffee, so he has to control them. His goal is for his children to be able to study and become professionals, and also to be able to have a bigger farm. This is the second financing that Leónidas has requested from FAMA and so far he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and hire labor.

loans.name: Rebeca Fabiola

texts.es:
Rebeca, una joven de 27 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Managua, soltera, estudiante universitaria, es dueña de una pequeña pulpería la cual tiene 2 años de estar funcionando. Inicio vendiendo leche agria y helados, con el tiempo sus vecinos le preguntaban  si vendía otros productos comestibles además que lo proveedores le ofrecían vender gaseosas, snacks y jugos. Además que en donde vive esta cerca una escuela primaria esto la motivo aún más poner una pulpería poco a poco le fue agregando productos comestibles así como artículos escolares. Ella comparte sus actividades en el negocio con su mama y una hermana. 
Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, productos lácteos, artículos de limpieza, artículos escolares, cosméticos. Esta inversión le permitirá surtir de más productos su negocio lo cual resulta muy atractivo para sus clientes. Uno de sus proyectos es agregar  la venta de productos literarios como diccionarios, libros de historia, enciclopedias.
texts.en:
Rebeca, 27, is a native of the city of Managua.  She is a single university student, and she is also the owner of a small grocery store that has been in business for 2 years.  She started out selling fermented milk and ice cream.  Over time, her neighbors were asking her if she could sell other food products, so she also started to sell soft drinks, snacks and juices.  Because she lives close to an elementary school, she decided to expand her store gradually by adding school supplies and additional food items.  Rebeca shares her activities in the business with her mother and a sister.

Rebeca is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, dairy products, cleaning products, school supplies and cosmetics.  This investment will allow her to stock up her business with more products so that it is more appealing to her customers.  One of her plans is to start selling books such as dictionaries, history books and encyclopedias.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, cleaning products, school supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Rosa, 39 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, casada, madre de tres hijos de los cuales son el menor de 15 años está a su cargo los otros dos viven independiente. Empezó con su negocio con ayuda de su esposo quien le dio capital para que iniciara su propio negocio y ella decidió instalar una mini pulpería. Actualmente tiene 2 años con su pulpería, la cual le ha permitido a ella independencia económica, aportar con los gastos del hogar y apoyar a su hijo menor en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja reparando radiadores con lo que gana ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares. 
Ella está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar un frízer usado, granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, jugos , gaseosas. Pues la temporada navideña es una de las mejores para el sector comercio y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender. Uno de sus proyectos es agregar la venta de ropa y carnes para ir poco a poco diversificando su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, is a retail merchant.  She is married and is the mother of 3 children.  Two of her children are living independently, and the youngest, who is 15, is still in her care.  Rosa started her business with the help of her husband, who gave her the start-up capital.  She decided to start a small grocery store.  

At this time, she's had 2 years of experience with her store.  It has allowed her to have financial independence, contribute to the household expenses, and support her youngest child in school.  Her husband works repairing radiators, and with his earnings he helps to pay the family's expenses.

Rosa needs a loan to buy a used freezer, basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, juices, and soft drinks.  As the Christmas season is one of the best times for business, she doesn't want to miss out on the opportunity to make sales.  One of her plans is to expand her business by selling clothing and meat.  This way, she could gradually diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy a used freezer, basic grains, cooking oil, cleaning products, juices, and soft drinks

loans.name: Maribell

texts.es:
Maribel, de 43 años, de oficio comerciante, casada, habitante de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio lo empezó vendiendo perfumes y telas. Cuando regreso a su pueblo de donde es originaria compro una vaca la cual después vendió y con el dinero obtenido logro poner su pulpería la cual solo vendía granos básicos con el tiempo le fue agregando nuevos, además se siente que su negocio beneficia a su clientela quienes a diario la visitan en busca de los necesario para el hogar. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, enlatados, aceite, jugos, gaseosas, productos lácteos, adornos navideños. La temporada de las ventas fuertes está cerca y quiere estar preparada para atender a sus clientas. Su meta próxima es agregarle nueva mercadería a su pulpería y pagar el crédito para sacar otro y comprar estantes, vitrinas para exhibir productos.
texts.en:
Maribel, 43, works as a saleswoman. She is married and lives in Managua. Maribel started her business selling perfumes and fabrics. When she returned to the town where she was born, she bought a cow and then sold it. With the money she made, she opened a corner store where she sold basic grains, but with time she started adding more things. She feels that her store is good for her customers, who regularly visit it looking for home supplies.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, canned food, oil, juices, sodas, dairy products and Christmas decorations. The upcoming season is good for selling and she wants to be prepared to serve her customers. Her short term goal is to add more merchandise to her store and pay back the loan. Then, she will request a new one and she will buy shelves and showcases to display her products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, canned food, oil, juices, sodas, dairy products and Christmas decorations.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He is a married businessman who carries out transport of goods and people, with a motorcycle. He has been in this trade for two years. He earns additional income by selling fire wood.

He learned of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access capital. He is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenyan shillings to buy fire wood and service the motorcycle. The only challenges in the business are the high cost of spare parts and fluctuating fuel prices. Raymond is determined to carry out his operations well despite the challenges, because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to purchase many motorcycles.

loans.use: To buy fire wood and service the motorcycle.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John has been running a shop and a cafe for the past 11 years. Both businesses give him a combined income of KES 80,000 per month.

 
He has a good credit history and is now servicing his third loan term with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to purchase maize flour, sugar, soap and other stock to boost his shop.


He intends to use his anticipated profits to support his family and boost his cafeteria business. He is hopeful that his business will expand to other regions.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, sugar, soap and other stock to boost his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a welding machine and spare parts to stock in the workshop.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina forma parte del Banco Comunal “Frutos del Progreso” perteneciente a la comuna de la florida, ubicada en la ciudad de Santiago.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de comida rápida, desde hace 6 años. Se desempeña en sus labores de lunes a domingo desde las 9ºº hasta las 18ºº horas y los fines de semana trabaja hasta las 02ºº de la mañana, tiene una persona que le ayuda en las ventas y preparación de sus productos, se desplaza con su carro a varias partes para aumentar sus ventas.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en supermercados, ferias, carnicerías y distribuidoras de bebida encontrando todo a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará otro carro para instalarlo en un terreno que ella tiene.
Una de las metas de Georgina es agregar otro tipo de productos a la venta como mote con huesillo, croquetas, hamburguesas que su misma clientela le ha ido solicitando, además instalarse en su terreno para poder colocar sus maquinas y agrandar su negocio, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y una  mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
Georgina vive junto a su esposo, un hijo que se encuenta delicado de salud, una hija y su nieta. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es instalar un negocio estable en su terreno para no andar de un lado a otro y a la vez tener mas clientela, ya que tendría un negocio bastante cómodo y agradable para recibir a su clientela.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio.
Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
La Florida es una comuna ubicada al suroriente de Santiago, capital de Chile, región Metropolitana. Su población actual es muy diversa, representando a todos los sectores socioeconómicos (alto, medio alto, medio y medio bajo). La zona cuenta con una activa vida comercial, la que se manifiesta en la existencia de varios nuevos centros comerciales. Es un sector que ha tenido un explosivo crecimiento demográfico en los últimos años.
texts.en:
Georgina is a part of the “Frutos del Progreso” communal bank, located in the Florida community, of the City of Santiago.

She has been selling fast food for six years and works Monday thru Friday from 9:00a to 6:00p and ‘til 2:00a on the weekends.  She has someone to help her with sales and preparation and she travels around to different locations by car in order to increase her sales.

She buys her supplies and merchandise at supermarkets, fairs, and soft drink distributers at low cost for the most part.

She will use the money from this loan to buy another car that she will keep on her land.

One of Georgina’s goals is to add another items that her customers have requested, such as “mote con huesillo” (a traditional Chilean summer-time non-alcoholic drink made from wheat and peaches), crockets, and hamburgers.  She would also like to set up on her land so that she can set up her equipment and expand her business.  In this way she can increase her income and improve her family’s quality of life.

Georgina lives with her husband, her son who is of fragile health, her daughter, and a niece.  Her dreams are to create a stable business so that she doesn’t have to move around and so that she can increase her number of customers and serve them comfortably.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she has gotten through Fondo Esperanza because it’s allowed her to invest in her business.

She also feels very comfortable with the companionship from the rest of the communal bank’s members, who have diverse interests and activities.  The training she has had at the various meetings has also helped her to better manage her business.



The Florida community is located southeast of metropolitan area of Santiago, the capital of Chile.  Its population is very diverse, representing all socio-economic sectors (high, upper middle, middle, and lower middle).  The zone has an active business life and manifests itself in the form of many business centers.  This sector has experienced an explosive demographic growth in recent years.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Nasipa

texts.ru: Насипа 60 лет, вдова.Насипа начала заниматься животноводством и растениеводством, ставшим основным источником финансирования ее семьи. Насипа начала свой бизнес со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS) в 2006 году, и смогла развить свое хозяйство, насчитывающее 1 корову с теленком и 10 баранов, с ежемесячной прибылью в 3,000 сом (KGS). На своей земле Насипа выращивает сено и ячмень. Скот она откармливает и продает на местном скотском рынке. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Насипа обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Доходы Насипа планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем -отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Nasipa is 60 years old and a widow. She has begun working in animal husbandry and raising crops, and this has become the main source of income for her family. In 2006, she began her business with a start-up sum of only 3,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) She has managed to develop her farm, which now includes 1 cow and calf and 10 sheep, bringing in monthly earnings of 3,000 KGS. On her land, Nasipa grows barley and straw. She fattens cows and sells them at the local cattle market. For the purpose of further developing her business, Nasipa has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 30,000 Som (KGS) to buy more cattle. She plans to use the extra income generated by this loan to re-invest in her business and, in the future, to renovate her home.

loans.use: To purchase cows

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 43 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Шамигул портниха. Она вместе с дочерью занимается шитьем национальных платьев. В этой области Шамигул уже десять лет. Она берет кредит для покупки швейной машинки.
texts.en: Shamigul lives in the Khuroson region. She is 43 years old, married, and has 6 children. She is a seamstress, and she and her daughter work together sewing national dresses. Shamigul has been doing this for 10 years. She is now seeking a loan to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Takku Ligguey Sam N 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement "Takku Ligguey SAM 6" se compose de 5 femmes.Une seule de ces femmes est célibataire.Les quatre autres sont mariées et mères de famille.Elles vendent des tissus et des produits cosmétiques. Elles s'approvisionnent en Gambie et revendent leurs produits à crédit.Ce commerce leur permet de subvenir aux dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles et à leurs propres besoins.Le chef de groupe ( main levée, au milieu), est mère de deux enfants.Elle vend des produits cosmétiques,des chaussures de femmes et d'enfants. Elle participe fortement aux dépenses d'alimentation et de santé de la famille.Le groupe sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des tissus.
texts.en: The "Takku Ligguey SAM 6" group is made up of five women. Only one of the women is single. The four others are married mothers. They sell fabric and cosmetics. They stock up in Gambia and resell their products on credit. This business allows them to provide for their families' spending and their own needs. The group leader (with her hand raised, in the center) is the mother of two children. She sells cosmetics, and women's and children's shoes. She participates strongly as a provider for her children's food expenses and the family's health expenses. The group is asking for a loan of 500,000 XOF.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: Lkhagvatseren

texts.en:
Lkhagvatseren is 36 years old, lives with his wife and a 13-year-old son in their house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. Their house is located in the area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Lkhagvatseren has been running a transportation business with his wife since 2000. He rides a micro-bus with 14 seats and runs through the east and west sides of the city. His wife works as a conductor and gathers the money from passengers for the transportation. Lkhagvatseren loves his micro-bus because it provides money to his family. 

So before the winter Lkhagvatseren is planning to build a garage near his house to prevent the car from freezing up. If his car breaks down he would need more days to fix the car and to spend additional expenses.

loans.use: to build a garage near his house to prevent the car from freezing up.

loans.name: Tuvshinbold

texts.en:
Tuvshinbold is 29 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old daughter in their house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. 

During the last two years Tuvshinbold has been doing a plumbing job on call and running a taxi business. His wife has been working as a planning officer in a cashmere factory. Last winter, Tuvshinbold insulated the walls of his house by taking a loan. He repaid the loan in October. Tuvshinbold thanks Kiva lenders, for his family has improved their living conditions and are ready to face the winter.

This time Tuvshinbold is requesting a loan to build a garage. By building a garage Tuvshinbold can prevent his car from breaking down due to the cold.

loans.use: to build a garage in order to prevent his car from breaking down.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-Erdene is 19 years old and lives with her husband in their ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Ulaanbaatar. She runs a taxi business and her husband works as a plasterer. They built the ger nearby the parents' house, on the plot of land of her parents-in-law. Both sets of parents bought a ger as a gift for their wedding. 

In the future, Bolor-Erdene wants to have her own land and house, and to educate herself at university. She tried to get into university this year but she was late for admissions.

As a young married couple, Bolor-Erdene and her husband want to buy furniture to furnish their ger in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture to furnish her ger.

loans.name: Magraj

texts.en:
Magraj is 47 years old and the head of the family. She lives with her son in the Bayan-Ulgii province. Her son Erkinbek is 22 years old and works in a rivate company.

She has been operating a toy store since 1994. In the past few months she was sick and her business stopped temporarily, but now she is restarting her store again and importing toys from Taikeshken. 

She is requesting a loan of 3.500.000 MNT to import toys for her toy store and restart her business. She is hard-working and a kind person.

loans.use: to restart her business by importing toys.

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren keeps doing his business and his business is going quite well. He has fully repaid his previous loan in October as scheduled. During this period he never missed a due date. 

Ever since Davaasuren has been cooperating with Kiva, some changes have occurred in his life and business. Now Davaasuren sells his souvenirs in Inner Mongolia of China and has met a regular purchaser. Every two months he goes to China to sell his souvenirs and if he has a great amount of orders he hires 2 or 3 people to help him. 

He is sure that if he hadn't been introduced to Kiva he would be living as before. Davaasuren expressed his deep gratitude to Kiva lenders for helping people, including himself. With their support, Davaasuren has had a chance to change his life. Therefore, his business goes well.

Davaasuren is planning to build a house next spring. This time Davaasuren is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to buy materials which will be used to build the house, as their price is low right now.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a house.

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru:
Очень талантливый и целеустремленный молодой человек, которого зовут Акмалчон, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как его родители не в состоянии оплатить за его учебу. Акмалчону 19 лет. Он студент 2 курса Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Он отлично окончил школу, и данное время является одним из успешных студентов. Его однокурсники и преподаватели уважают его за то, что у него есть все черты хорошего человека: толерантность, интеллигентность и мотивация. Не давно, у него была семестровая работа, и он сдал отлично и хорошо. Этот талантливый студент учится на договорной основе и должен оплатить за учебный договор каждый год. Акмалчон трудно справляется с расходами студенческой жизни, так как у него самого нет источника дохода, а его родители работают в государственных учреждениях и получают маленькую зарплату. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для оплаты учебы в университете. 
Этот займ поможет ему оплатить за учебный договор и таким образом окончить 2 курс и приближаться в цели. Он надеется только на вас и обещает погашать займ во время, так как его родители помогут ему в этом.
texts.en:
A very talented and goal-oriented young man named Akmaljon needs your help, since his parents aren't in a position to pay his tuition.  Akmaljon is 19 years old and a second year student at the Tajik Technical University.  He graduated from high school with excellent grades and presently, he is one of the best students at the university.  His classmates and teachers respect him for having all the traits of a good person:  tolerance, intellectuality, and motivation.  He recently had an end-of-semester assignment, for which he got good and excellent marks.

This talented student isn't subsidized by the government and must pay his tuition every year.  It's difficult for Akmaljon to deal with the expenses of student life as he himself has no source of income and his parents work in government bureaus where they receive small salaries.  He is requesting a loan for $1000 for the payment of his university tuition.  This loan will help him by paying his tuition to finish his second year and move closer to his goals.  He is relying only on you and he promises to repay the loan on time as his parents will help him with this.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition

loans.name: Monhjargal

texts.en: Mrs. Monhjargal is 42 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ger in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband Tushig is in South Korea working as a contract worker. Her son Temuujin, 21, is a university student, and her son Tsolmon, 15, is a secondary school student. She has been working as a saleswoman since 2001 in the local market. She also works part-time at home as a tailor. She is now planning to start her own business of clothing retail at a rental counter of the local market. She is now requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase clothes to start her business of clothing retail at a rental counter at the local market. She is a hardworking and friendly person.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to start her business of clothing retail at a rental counter of the local market

loans.name: Monhtsetseg

texts.en: Mrs. Monhtsetseg is 38 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in their house in the Han-Uul District of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband Batsaihan, 37, works as a security guard for a private company. Her daughter Hulan, 15, is a secondary school student. Her son Bat-Irmuun, 2, stays at home. She has been working as a hairdresser for 3 years, and she is now planning to start her own business of a barber shop in a spare room in their house. She is now asking for a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase hairdresser equipment, tools and other necessary stuff for her business. She is a hardworking and open-minded person.

loans.use: to purchase hairdresser equipment, tools and other necessary stuff for her business

loans.name: Mereke

texts.en:
Mr.Mereke, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in their house in Bayan-Ulgii province in Mongolia. His wife Gulsheker works part-time at a local school, while his son Ahjol is a primary school student and his daughter Ahbota goes to kindergarten.

A hardworking, diligent and honest person, Mereke has been providing a taxi service for four years now. His car has broken down and he is now requesting a loan of 1'500'000MNT to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to run his taxi service business.

loans.use: to purchase an eco-friendly electric and gas car to run his taxi service business.

loans.name: Hagar

texts.en:
Hagar is from the Jerusalem area. For six years, she has been refurbishing vintage pieces of furniture, creating unique children’s pieces and other furniture designs. Recently she as reopened her studio where she refurbishes furniture and creates special pieces. Hagar is planning on working half time at a specialty furniture store and has come to an agreement with them to sell her pieces on consignment. In addition, she is taking orders and selling directly from her studio.

Hagar is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase stock and refurbishing materials.  She is known for her high quality pieces and fair prices. She wants to continue developing children’s pieces, refurbishing vintage furniture, and creating specialty pieces to a larger clientele base.

loans.use: to purchase stock and refurbishing materials.

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward de 44 años, es un hombre emprendedor y soñador. Vive en su propia casa junto a su conviviente María quien es su socia en la actividad de ventas de bebidas gasificadas. Tienen 2 hijas, quienes estudian  en el colegio.
El trabajo de Edward consiste en la venta de bebidas gasificadas tales como cervezas de  distintas marcas y  gaseosas  de sabores variables, cuenta con una congeladora lo que le permite tener las bebidas siempre heladas al gusto del cliente. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local que esta en el interior de su propia casa. Lleva 6 años en este negocio y le esta yendo bien. pues comenta que se inicio en este negocio porque en el lugar donde vive no había tienda donde comprar estas bebidas. Considera rentable su actividad económica por el intenso calor que hay en la ciudad, por ello la gente consume más bebidas, entonces sus ventas se incrementan y obtiene ganancias favorables. Comenta que  los problemas que tenía al principio eran por no poder  adquirir las bebidas demandadas por los clientes por falta de capital de respaldo. Espera surgir y contar con el capital para reconstruir su local para dar mejor atención a la gente que acude a su negocio. Por tanto éste será su préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, está contento de ser socio del grupo del cual es parte, porque los demás socios son puntuales y responsables. Esta agradecido con la institución ya que le da la oportunidad de tener un capital de respaldo. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles  comprará un equipo de sonido, mesas, sillas, etc. Para mejorar la  atención e incrementar su clientela. Entonces  incrementara sus ganancias  y pagara sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Edward, 44 years old, is an entrepreneur and a dreamer. He lives in his own home with his partner María, who helps him in the activity of selling carbonated beverages. They have two children who are studying in school.

Edward’s work consists of selling carbonated beverages such as different brands of beer, and soft drinks of various flavors. He has a freezer which permits him to have iced cold drinks to please his customers. This work is done in a facility that is at his own house. He has been in this business for six years and it’s going well. He says that he began this business because the place where he lives did not have a store where you could buy these drinks. He considers it a profitable business because of the intense heat of the city, causing people to drink more beverages, then his sales increase and he gets better profits. 

He says that the problems that he had at first were because he could not buy the drinks his customers wanted due to the lack of capital backing. He is waiting to raise capital in order to rebuild his facility to give better service to the people that come to his business. So this will be his fourth loan through the institution MFP. He is happy being a member of the group of which he is a part, because the other members are punctual and responsible.

He is grateful to the institution because it offers the opportunity of having capital backing. With the requested amount of 2000 soles he will buy a sound system, tables and chairs, etc., in order to improve the service and increase his customer base. Then his earnings will increase and he will make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a sound system, and tables and chairs to give atmosphere to his business

loans.name: Isabela

texts.es: Isaela de 63 años, es una mujer innovadora, esforzada y soñadora. Vive en su casa propia junto a Edmundo su conviviente que a la vez es su socio en el trabajo que realiza, que es la  siembra de plantas cítricas; como son limones, mandarinas, naranjas; asimimo se dedica en la crianza de ganado vacuno como actividad secundaria. Realiza su labor en su Finca que esta a un kilómetro de su vivienda. Lleva 20 años en el cultivo de cítricos, pues anteriormente no tenia los medios para sustentar su familia, es así que deciden dedicarse a esta actividad. Ahora junto a su conviviente y 2 obreros que contrata, se dedican al riego, fertilización y cuidado de los cultivos. Cuando cosechan transportan los productos a los diferentes mercados de la ciudad para venderlos al por mayor. Considera rentable su negocio, pues los precios de los productos cítricos esta en aumento de precio. Al comenzar a trabajar en este rubro no tenía el conocimiento suficiente sobre productos cítricos y  no contaba con el capital suficiente, así que decidido informarse, capacitarse  y decidió junto a su conviviente hacer  un préstamo para iniciar  su labor económica. Espera seguir manteniendo su negocio que va creciendo cada día más. Por tanto será su préstamo número 20  con la institución MFP, esta muy agradecida con la institución porque con el préstamo le ayudan  acrecentar su capital. Se lleva muy bien con la gente del grupo de la cual es socia, por que todos tienen las ganas de seguir creciendo y  ser puntuales en sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado  4000 soles, lo utilizará en la compra de abono, fertilizantes, para obtener una buena producción y también pagara a los obreros que la ayudan en la siembra y cosecha de su producto.
texts.en: Isabela is 63 years old. She is an innovative and hard-working woman and a dreamer. She lives in her own house together with Edmundo, her live-in partner who is also her partner in the work she does: growing citrus fruits such as limes, mandarines and oranges. She also works raising cattle as a secondary activity. She carries out her work on her farm, which is one kilometer from her home. She has been growing citrus fruits for 20 years, since previously she did not have the means to support her family. Because of this, they decided to dedicate themselves to this activity. Now together with her partner and 2 contracted workers, they water, fertilize and cultivate the crops. When they harvest the fruits, they transport them to the various markets of the city and sell them on a wholesale basis. She considers her business profitable, since the prices for citrus fruits are rising. When she began working in this area, she did not have sufficient knowledge about citrus fruits and did not have enough capital. Thus, she decided to become informed and get training, and she decided together with her partner to take out a loan to start her economic activity. She hopes to continue to maintain her business, which keeps growing day by day. Thus, this will be loan number 20 for her with the MFP institution, and she is very grateful to the institution because the loan will help her increase her capital. She gets along very well with the people in the group where she is a member, because all of them have the desire to keep growing and to be punctual with their payments. With the amount she is requesting, 4000 soles, she will buy fertilizers and compost to obtain good production, and she will also pay the laborers who help her grow and harvest her products.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and compost and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana de 42 años, es una mujer amable y  alegre; esta casada con Rubén, quien trabaja en la municipalidad de la ciudad. Vive en su casa propia junto a sus 3 hijas, quienes estudian en la universidad. El trabajo de Eliana consiste en la venta de abarrotes  como arroz, aceite, harina, sal, leche, huevos, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas  entre otros, esta actividad la realiza en un local en el interior de su casa propia.  Se inicio en esta actividad por sus hijos a quienes ama, y lograr darles una  mejor calidad de vida, solventar sus estudios e ingresen a la universidad. Su esposo la ayuda en sus compras en las distintas distribuidoras donde venden al por mayor, para que obtengan un incremento en sus ganancias. Lleva 4 años en esta actividad y le esta yendo muy bien. Espera agrandar el local donde esta, quiere surgir  e incrementar sus ganancias. Por tanto éste será su prestamo número 3 con la institución  MFP,  esta muy contenta con su grupo por que la tratan amablemente, esto la motiva a seguir pagando sus cuotas a tiempo. Tiene tranquilidad ya que cuenta con un capital de respaldo, con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, lo utilizará para comprar y abastecerse de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, aceite, harina, sal, leche, huevos, etc. Para que sus clientes sigan permaneciendo y sena fieles a su negocio.
texts.en:
Eliana, who is 42 years old, is a pleasant and cheerful woman. She is married to Rubén, who is a municipal employee in the city where they live. She lives in her own house together with her 3 daughters, who are studying at university. 

Eliana sells groceries, such as rice, oil, flour, salt, milk, eggs, sweets and carbonated soft drinks, etc. She carries out this activity from a premises that is part of her own home.
