She started this business because of her children, whom she loves, in order to give them a better quality of life. She also hoped it would pay for their studies and that they would go to university. Her husband helps her with the purchases she makes from the different wholesale distributors. She buys goods wholesale to increase her earnings. 

She has run this business for 4 years and it is going very well. She hopes to expand her premises. She also wants to increase her profits. For this reason she is requesting the loan, which is her third from MFP.  She is very happy with her group because they treat her kindly. This motivates her to continue making her payments on time. Also she finds it reassuring that there is backup capital. She will use the 1500 soles to buy and sell basic necessities, such as rice, oil, flour, salt, milk and eggs, etc.  In this way she hopes that her customers will continue to buy from her and be loyal to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, flour, salt, milk and eggs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia de 65 años, es una mujer fuerte y amable. Es divorciada. Vive en su casa propia junto con sus 2 hijas de 20 y 22 años quienes la acompañan y la ayudan en su negocio familiar.
El trabajo de Lucia consiste  en brindar un tiempo de distracción y diversión a sus clientes, su centro de entretenimiento esta ubicado al costado de su vivienda.  Cuenta con una piscina y diferentes ambientes como un lugar de venta de bebidas gasificadas, comidas, entre otras.  Comenta que se inicio en este negocio  porque sus amigos buscaban un lugar  donde relajarse, distraerse  y no había  un ambiente adecuado, fue entonces que decidió aperturar dicho negocio. Cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijas quienes le ayudan en la atención de las personas que recurren a este lugar cada fin de semana. También la ayudan en la venta de entradas para bañarse en la piscina y en la preparación de  distintos platos de comida.  Considera rentable su negocio porque las personas cada fin de semana buscan un ambiente acogedor  donde puedan pasarla en familia  y considera que su recreo es el indicado. Quiere seguir manteniendo su negocio y seguir creciendo como empresaria. Por tanto éste será su préstamo numero 2  con la institución MFP, esta  muy emocionada porque en su grupo la acogieron con amabilidad. Espera seguir siendo socia de este grupo. 
Con el monto solicitado  1000  soles, lo utilizará para comprar un refrigerador de 900 soles y también comprará  víveres para preparar  las distintas viandas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucia, 65, is a kind and strong woman. She is divorced and lives in her own home with her two daughters ages 20 and 22 who help her with the family business. Lucia’s work is to provide a time of distraction and entertainment to customers. Her entertainment center is located on the side of her house. It features a swimming pool and different environments such as a place to sell soft drinks, food, among others. She says she started this business because her friends were looking for a place to unwind and relax and there wasn’t a suitable place. It was then she decided to open this business. She relies on her daughters’ help who help in the care of people who use this place every weekend. Also they help in selling tickets to swim in the pool and in the preparation of various dishes. She considers her business profitable because every weekend people look for a place to have fun with their family and she considers her place to be suitable. She wants to continue with her business and continue to grow as an entrepreneur. 

This will be her second loan with MFP institution. She is very excited because her group has welcomed her with kindness. She hopes to continue to be a member of this group. With the requested amount of 1000 Peruvian soles she will buy a refrigerator for 900 Peruvian soles and buy supplies to prepare various meat in her business.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and products to prepare food.

loans.name: Nonito

texts.en:
Nonito is a 56-year-old resident of Lower Usogan, Bonifacio, in the Philippines. For 33 years, Nonito has helped to support his family, using the small amount of money he generates (6,000 PHP monthly) from his corn and coconut production business. 

This year, as a member of GDMPC, Nonito is applying for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops for his business. One day, Nonito hopes to expand his corn and coconut production business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to support his corn and coconut production business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 27 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chona has been raising pigs for two years, and she earns additional income from selling medicine.

Chona is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lamdaria

texts.en:
Lamdaria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 16,500 through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Lamdaria has been in this business for nine years. Lamdaria earns more income from growing bananas.

Lamdaria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.en:
Saturnino is 48 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is married with one child.
 
Saturnino is engaged in the fruit and vegetable production and selling business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in building a fruit and vegetable stand for his existing business.
 
Saturnino became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Saturnino hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To build a fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Merlina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from buying and selling rice and from farming vegetables. Merlina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF, to purchase additional bananas to resell.

Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to resell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two children. She is 59 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.

To earn a living, Elizabeth has a snack vending business. She has had this business for almost two years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 1,500. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

Elizabeth hopes to improve her life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 50 years old and married with nine children.

Letecia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc..

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and earns additional income from rice and vegetables vending.

Letecia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to finish sending two of her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, spices, bread, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Trivinia

texts.en:
Trivinia is 65 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao. She is single with no children. 

Trivinia has a shop selling grocery items and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase 8 cases of soft drinks and 10 boxes of grocery items.

Trivinia has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and boxes of grocery items to sell

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilyn is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for her fishing boat.

Marilyn has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her fishing boat

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en:
Mrs Purevsuren is 54 years old and lives with her husband and daughter, in their small wooden house in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. She has a job, working as a cleaner in a local company. Her husband doesn’t have a job. Her daughter is 18 years old and attends University. Her son is living in the countryside, and every month he sends some money home for his family. Purevsuren’s family has a low income, but they live a life full of happiness. 

Purevsuren is planning to reconstruct her house, and to thicken the walls with materials that keep the heat in as long as possible. She will use brick to thicken the house walls on the outside, and basalt wool (rockwool insulation) on the inside. By doing this, she can cut the usage of charcoal by several times, in comparison with the house as it currently stands. Purevsuren will use the loan to repair her house and to thicken and insulate its walls.

loans.use: to repair her house, and to thicken and insulate its walls

loans.name: Zoila Esperanza

texts.es: Zoila Esperanza de cuarenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su familia; ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de dedicarse a este rubro por eso se ha hecho de gran experiencia, eso le ayuda a obtener muy buenas cosechas, comercia en todos los alrededores de la zona y ya tiene mucha clientela pues saben  que todo lo que comercia es de muy buena calidad y aprecios accesibles además el servicio es excelente, para complementar los gastos del hogar también vende tortillas pues es muy rentable y ella se provee el maiz; Zoila es una mujer emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante sabe que solo con esfuerzo y dedicación lograra un futuro mejor, en la última cosecha tuvo  grandes pérdidas, en esta temporada de siembra quiere recuperarse invirtiendo en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizante, insecticida, leña etc. Zoila Esperanza tiene buenas referencias de pago, es muy responsable y está segura que saldara la deuda y a la vez le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Zoila Esperanza is 45 years old and lives with her family.  She farms, has been raising corn for several years, and has gained lots of experience.  This has helped her obtain good harvests which she sells all around the zone and has many customers.  They know that everything she sells is of good quality, at good prices, and with excellent service.  She also sells tortillas and it’s very profitable.  Zoila is an enterprising woman with a great desire to get ahead and knows that she will create a better future with dedication and effort.  She had some losses in her latest harvest and she wants to recover during this planting season by investing in supplies, so she has requested a loan through INTEGRAL.  This will allow her to buy corn seed, fertilizer, insecticide, firewood, etc.  Zoila Esperanza has a good payment record, is very responsible, and is sure that she will get out of debt and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Esperanza

texts.es: Rosa Esperanza de veintinueve años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida; ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado de engorde, tiene varios años de dedicarse al rubro y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia valiosa en el negocio,  es muy conocida en la zona y se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque todo lo que comercia es de calidad, lo vende a un buen  precio y el servicio es excelente, Rosa Esperanza es una mujer ejemplar, entregada a su trabajo siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan salir adelante pues sabe que así podrá alcanzar el éxito, En esta última temporada tuvo algunas perdidas y tiene el deseo de recuperarse pero necesita invertir en insumos por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita ganado. Rosa Esperanza tiene buenas referencias crediticias y tiene la certeza que podrá cancelar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Esperanza, 29, lives with her life partner.  She makes a living raising livestock.  She has done this work for several years and has a lot of valuable experience in the business.  She's well known in the area and has acquired a lot of customers because everything she sells is of high quality and reasonably priced, and her service is excellent.

Rosa Esperanza is an exemplary woman who is devoted to her job.  She's always waiting for new opportunities that will allow her to get ahead, because she knows that this way she'll be successful.

This past season she had some losses and she wants to recover from them.  She needs to invest in supplies, though, so she's asking Integral for a loan to buy livestock.

Rosa Esperanza has good credit references and is certain that she'll be able to repay the debt.  She also trusts that she'll give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old and lives in Goaw, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children.

To earn a living, Marilyn has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks. She earns about 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Marilyn has requested a loan to purchase foods for snacks to sell/retail.

Marilyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Marilyn would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food for snacks to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a rice mill business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to pay for the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Letecia has been in this business for 25 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and lives in Poblacion Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married with three children. Virginia has been earning a living by running a business where she sells ready-to-wear ( RTW) clothing and she has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 9,000 PHP from this type of work. 

Virginia has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to purchase more RTW clothing. She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Virginia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has one child. She is 56 years old and lives in the municipality of Titay in Zamboanga Sibugay Province.

Marilou sells sari-sari products to earn a living and had this business for 12 years. Each month, she earns 4,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP for additional capital.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC during this year. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Abdurrahman

texts.en:
Abdurrahman, 32, work as a fisherman. His wife works as a teacher in an elementary school. He has two toddlers. 

As a fisherman, Abdurrahman goes to sea to catch fish and sells them to the big buyer. He has a speciality in selling fish: He only sells ornamental fish and lobster.
 
Abdurrahman wants to increase his business. He wants to directly sell the fish and lobster to the city to get a higher price. He needs a loan to make it. He borrowed 5,000,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah) to purchase more ornamental fish and lobsters. Besides purchasing ornamental fish and lobsters, the loan will also be used to fix his boat. 

He hopes his plan to sell directly to the city to get a higher price will work and he can earn a satisfactory profit. Abdurrahman has a dream to buy a car when he has enough money to make it easier to distribute the fish and lobsters to the city.

loans.use: to purchase more ornamental fish and lobsters.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is a 61-year-old resident of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Nenita provides for her family from the little amount of 4,000 she gains monthly from her gardening business of three years. Since 2006 she has been a member of GDMPC. She will use the loan of 7,500 from GDMPC to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Nenita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business. Nerlita has been in this business for three years. She  earns more income from buy and sell charcoal.

Nerlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is married with two children. Benjamin is 53 years old and lives in the village of Baybay in the municipality of Liloy in Zamboanga del Norte Province.

Benjamin sells merchandise to earn a living and had this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 30,000 PHP doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP for additional capital.

Benjamin has been a member of PMPC for this year. In the future, Benjamin hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and soap

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more stock of bananas to sell for her business.

Shirley has been in this business for one year. Shirley earns more income from buying and selling rice.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en:
Ramona is married with seven children. Ramona is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Salug, Zamboanga del Norte.

Ramona owns an eatery/restaurant to earn a living and has had this business for 17 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business.

Ramona has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Ramona hopes to expand her eatery/restaurant business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her eatery business.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
This is Nelia. She previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy more merchandise items and products like detergent soap, fabric softener, lotion, deodorant and other products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelia hopes to be successful in her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items like ladies' shoes, shirts, toothpaste lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is single, 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. Paul is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this for four years, and every month he earns 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from this work. 

He has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Paul became a member of GDMPC this year. In the future, Paul hopes to gain double his income from his business.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married with 3 children. She is 55 years old and lives in Maloro, Tangub City.
To earn a living, Marilou has a snack vending business. She has had this business for almost 1 years. Each day, she earns approximately PHP 200. Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 1 year and 6 months.
In the future, Marilou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
This is Adelfa, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jeffrey and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Adelfa maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12, 000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like ladies' shoes, shirts, lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Adelfa hopes to give her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like ladies' shoes, shirts, lotion, deodorant, perfume and other personal products needed in her business.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.en:
Consuelo, aged 58, is a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo and is a mother to their children. She manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Consuelo operates a buy-and-sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers, selling the items for a small profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes and other similar items. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options that she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 23,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear (RTW) products and items such as pants, shirts, dresses, undergarments, etc. to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Consuelo hopes to be able to expand her business and dreams of having a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies there.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as pants, dresses, shirts, undergarments, etc. to sell in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Maylin

texts.en:
This is Ma. Maylin, 36, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, a liaison officer, and she is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ma. Maylin maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ma. Maylin hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams of having their own house and lot. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To  purchase supplies and merchandise like perfume, powder, soap, deodorant, shampoo, lotion and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
Malia  is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. 

She has a small farm and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Malia has requested a loan to buy young piglets, barbed wire for the fence, pig food and a wheelbarrow.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Malia hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy young piglets, barbed wire, pig food and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is a 35-year-old married woman with five kids. She lives in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Rosie manages a gardening business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She joined GDMPC in 2006. Rosie wishes that her business will increase.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ritche

texts.en:
Ritche is from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental and is 36 years old. He is married and has 1 child. 

To make a living, Ritche owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. Ritche has been engaged in this business for 7 years and earns 15,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2006, Ritche joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
This is Salvacion. She previously accessed a loan of 15,000 PHP that she used to buy spare parts, accessories, and to maintain her tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle unit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Salvacion dreams of being able to give her children a high quality education through all her hard work. She hopes to have more tricycles. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her motorized tricycle.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 43 years old and lives in La Esperanza, Rizal. She is married with no children.
 
Emelita has a bread-making business and earns approximately 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients needed to make bread. 

Emelita has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase five sacks of flour and other ingredients needed to make bread.

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en: Jenette is 33 years old and lives in Mitacas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. Jenette works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan to purchase five boxes of fish to sell. Jenette has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 37 years old and lives in New Dapitan, Rizal. She is married with two children. Lorena has a retail business and earns approximately 6,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase additional stock for her store. Lorena has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store.

location.town: Calamba-New Dapitan, Rizal, Zambo. Del Norte

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is married with four children. She is 59 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. Gloria sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 6,800 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 to purchase additional stocks. Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to sell.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 36 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Ana Marie is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Marie has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from tailoring and from motorcycle transport.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening, farming sugarcane and rice retailing. Wilma is borrowing 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc., for her general store business.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, eggs, soft drinks, etc., in her general store.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
This is Clarissa. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her bakery. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Clarissa also has a variety store, and the loan will be of help to her store as well. Her profits from the business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Clarissa dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients, such as flour, sugar, butter and other ingredients needed in her bakery.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is  a mother, married to Abner, a chopper. With her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Helen oversees the operations multicab transportation business. She owns one multicab (12-14 person capacity). A multicab is practical utility vehicle. It can also be used for product deliveries but now is mostly used for passenger transportation. The driver pays boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 per day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts, and to pay for maintenance work on her multicab unit. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Helen dreams to have a good life and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members each week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for the maintenance of her multicab unit.

loans.name: Darwin

texts.en:
This is Darwin, 40, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. His wife is Gemma, a housewife and a father to their children. He together with his wife manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Darwin operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. His store is located adjacent to his house. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business. 

Darwin hopes to give his children a good and quality education. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in his business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida is married with three children. She is 52 years old and lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Adelaida buys and sells ready-to-wear dresses (RTWs) to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 9,000 for additional capital to buy more RTWs. Adelaida has been a member of PMPC this year. In the future, Adelaida hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear dresses to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a general store business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc. Yolanda has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Yolanda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a new member of PMPC under the microfinance program. She is 47 years old and married with three children, two adult-aged and one school-aged. She lives in Pasihagon, Siquijor, Siquijor. The major source of the family's income is fishing, which has primarily been operated by her husband for seven years and brings in an average monthly income of 2,000 PHP. Emma took a loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,000 to purchase fishing nets. She hopes to catch more fish by using her new fishing nets and improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina works hard to support her family. Cristina is married and has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. Cristina has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. Cristina has been in this business for 15 years now. In the future, Cristina would like to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is married with three children. Monica is 54 years old and lives in Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Monica buys and sells charcoal to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP for additional capital to buy more sacks of charcoal.

Monica has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Monica hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

location.town: Liloy-Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Myagmar

texts.en: Mrs. Myagmar is 51 years old and the female at the head of her family. She lives with her brother in a house in Sainshand, in the Dornogobi province of Mongolia. Her brother, Chultemdorj, manufactures metal products such as fences, stoves, etc,. Her daughter, Davaasuren, has moved out and works as a teacher at a local school. Myagmar has been running a clothing retail stall for years and her business is currently in critical condition because of a lack of working capital. She is now requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to import clothes from China to sell at her rental counter at the local market. She is a diligent and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to import clothes from China to sell at her rental counter at the local market

loans.name: Mayvelyn

texts.en: Mayvelyn is 47 years old, married and has three children who are in school. Mayvelyn is in the agricultural business and earns money pig fattening in the Philippines. Mayvelyn has requested a loan of 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Mayvelyn has been pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Mayvelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
This time, for her 25th cycle loan, Azucena is applying for a loan of PHP 17000 to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs.  

The fishing business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide a means for Azucena and her family to increase income and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and medicines for pigs.

loans.name: Wilsonia

texts.en:
Wilsonia is 72 years old, married and has five children.

Wilsonia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs. 

Wilsonia has been raising pigs for 21 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Providencia

texts.en:
Providencia is 55 years old, married and has three children.

Providencia is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.  Providencia requested a 25,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Providencia has been for 6 years now in business, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Providencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is 33 years old, married and has two children in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Annalyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Annalyn requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos)loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat. 

Annalyn has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money so she could send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is thirty years old and married with one child.

Cristina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Cristina has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Cristina aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
Elvina is 47 years old and married with one kid. 

Elvina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Elvina requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

Elvina has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elvina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and medicines for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 45 years old and lives in Molatuhan Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is single.
Nelson has a store that sells a variety of products including soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others. He has had this business for 12 years. He has requested a loan of 14,950 PHP to purchase more stock for his general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap etc.
Nelson has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nelson hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for his general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap etc

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita lives in Buenavista, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 

Anecita has a vulcanizing shop.  She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 14,900 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase materials for her vehicle repair business.

In the future, Anecita hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her vehicle repair business

loans.name: Deselyn

texts.en:
Deselyn is married with seven children. Deselyn is 43 years old and lives in Zamora, Aloran Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Deselyn has a hog raising business. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000.00 Philippine pesos (PHP). She has requested a loan to purchase feeds for her hog raising business. Deselyn has been a member of PMPC for three years.

In the future, Deselyn hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is an active member of Paglaum MPC under the micro-finance program.  She is 36 years old and married with four school-age children. She has been operates a sari-sari store business selling a variety of grocery products. Melanie has engaged in the business for three years having a monthly average income of 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). She took another loan from PMPC in the amount of 3,500 PHP to purchase additional grocery stock for sale. In the future, Melanie hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for sale.

loans.name: Al

texts.en:
This is Al, 32, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Analyn, a housewife, and a father to their children. He together with his wife manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Al maintains a tricycle business. He owns and drives one unit of tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until wee hours in order to have a bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations of her business, he is requesting an amount of 10,000 PHP in his loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Al hopes to buy another tricycle unit and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Thilma

texts.en:
Thilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dressmaking business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 23000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her dressmaking business.

Thilma has been in this business for nine years. Thilma earns more income from motorcycle transport.

Thilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Milva

texts.en:
Milva is married with 3 children, 38 years old, and lives in Unidos, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.

Milva sells food to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan to pay for boxes of cocoa, sugar, and rice. Milva has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Milva hopes to have more savings for business capital and for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy boxes of cocoa, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира – женщина с прекрасной душой. У нее очень трудная судьба. Ее муж умер рано, когда Замира была совсем молодой. Когда умер ее муж, у них не было детей и вот так она осталось без мужа и без детей. Замира живет с сестрой и им не кому надеется. Несколько лет назад она начала бизнес купле продажей продуктовых товаров, но у нее не было достаточных навык о бизнесе, и поэтому она не смогла развивать бизнес. После провала в бизнесе она не подала духом и с новыми силами она решила организовать бизнес продовольственными товарами. В этот раз она начинает бизнес  с определенными планами, создавая бизнес план.  Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  продовольственных товаров. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия жизни.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму  550 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zamira is a woman with a kind soul. Though, she has had tough luck. Her husband died early, when she was still very young. They did not have any children and now Zamira is left without a husband or children. She lives with her sister, but they have very little to hope for. 

A few years ago Zamira started a grocery business. However, she did not have the necessary business skills and failed to develop the business. After the grocery failed, she did not lose heart. She gathered her strength and decided to organize a new grocery business. This time she is starting with a clear business plan. She received business training from the course "Bring It On", which was organized by the Business Women's Association. She received a certificate from this course. Now she is fully capable of successfully organizing her own business. 

She wants to start a grocery business again. She plans to use the new income to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a sum of 550 somoni to purchase the necessary goods to start her new grocery. She is waiting on your kindness!

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for organizing new business

loans.name: Egbeyemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe EGBEYEMI est formé de trois personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Nafissatou, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Nafissatou est âgée de 40 ans et est mariée à un certain Yacoubou. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble et assure ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Nafissatou a peu fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de sept ans que Nafissatou exerce comme activité, la vente des matelas dans un quartier du Bénin ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Nafissatou désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Nafissatou sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe EGBEYEMI, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The EGBEYEMI group is made up of three people who live in the same area. The representative of the group, named Nafissatou, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. This is the third time that the group is asking for financial support from Alidé with an eye to raising the level of their business. Nafissatou is 40 years old and is married to a man named Yacoubou. The couple has six children, all in school and in their care. The couple lives together and provides together for the household's various needs. Nafissatou attended little school. Nafissatou started her business about seven years old selling mattresses in an area of Benin, which allows her to meet the needs of her family without great difficult. In order to better respond to her customers' needs, Nafissatou wants to reinforce her business. To do this, Nafissatou is asking for a third loan together with the other members of the EGBEYEMI group. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy mattresses.

loans.name: Djily

texts.fr: Monsieur Djily vit au Sénégal dans l’une des localités de la banlieue. C’est un marchand ambulant qui s’active depuis 3 ans dans le petit commerce et vend des portables et accessoires. C’est un homme marié qui supporte les paiements de factures d’eau et d’électricité dans son foyer. Il démarre ses activités le matin a 10h pour rentrer a 20h30. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC  et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de portables et accessoires a revendre. Il souhaite développer son activité de commerce, accroitre ses revenus et être a mesure de mieux intervenir dans les dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille pour en priorité améliorer leurs conditions alimentaires. Il projette d’avoir son propre magasin pour y exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Djily lives in Senegal, in one of the towns located in the suburbs. He is a street vendor, and has worked in small-scale retail for the past three years, selling cellphones and accessories. He is a married man, and provides for the payment of his household water and electricity bills, starting work at 10 in the morning and returning home at 8:30 in the evening. 

Djily is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, and has requested a loan of 300,000 francs to buy cellphones and accessories for resale. He would like to develop his retail business, increase his income, and be able to better provide for his family’s daily expenses, so that he can meet his priority goal of providing them with better food. He plans to have his own store where he can carry out his business.

loans.use: To buy cellphones and accessories for resale.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: This time Ester is borrowing 15,000 PHP to buy raw materials for her nipa making business. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF and Kiva continues to provide for Ester and her family, helps increase income and helps improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her native nipa making business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 28 years old and married with three children. She has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Lilian requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lilian would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Exuperia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Exuperia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Exuperia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Exuperia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is 38 years old and has 2 children. She is married and her children are in school.

Geraldine has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Geraldine has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Geraldine would like to continue building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a a local eatery (carinderia) business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. NWTF is re-listing Annaliza's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Ganbaatar

texts.en:
Ganbaatar is 23 years old, and a helpful and open-minded person. He lives with wife and two year old daughter in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. Ganbaatar has been working as plumber in General Department of Taxation. Before doing this job, he had worked as a security guard in local transportation company. His wife had work as a waitress in a café. 

This summer Ganbaatar built a new house with his saved money. He used all their saved money and now he needs furniture for his home. He is asking for  a loan to buy new furniture such as bedroom furniture and living room furniture. By doing this his family will live in a comfortable condition.

loans.use: to buy furniture, such as bedroom furniture and living room furniture.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en: As a married woman and mother of nine children, Emerita works hard to support her family. She has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Emerita is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her tricycle. Emerita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her tricycle

loans.name: Ma. Liz

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Liz works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her bakery. Ma. Liz is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

Ma. Liz has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gallons of mineral water to resell

loans.name: Dionesia

texts.en:
Dionesia is 52 years old, married and has six children, two of whom are in school.

Dionesia has an agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Dionesia has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Dionesia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
This is Riza. She previously accessed an 25,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Riza dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of the tricycle.

loans.name: Bujin

texts.en: Mrs Bujin is 29 years old. Her family consists of six members: her husband, their two children, and her parents. They live in their wooden house in the ger district in Kherlen, the third largest city in Mongolia. It is an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Her parents operate a small food shop. Bujin has worked as a taxi driver since 2011 and her husband also runs a taxi business. Her son attends secondary school and her daughter stays home with the grandmother. In 2004 they got married and built their current house and bought some home furniture. However, in that moment as a new couple expecting a baby, they had a problem with money. Bujin is now requesting a loan of 1.000.000 MNT to buy new home furniture. By doing this her children will live in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to buy new home furniture

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Момагулу 35 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж Дилшод очень добрый человек и всегда старается поддержать Момагул, но он не везучий и не может зарабатывать деньги, хотя он очень упорно старается. С годами дети растут и требуют больше блага, питание, образование, одежда, обеспечение техниками это все требует массу денег. Момагул решила решать все финансовые проблемы путем бизнеса, от которого  она будет получать доход. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Momagul is 35 years old. She is married and has 3 children in her care. Her husband Dilshod is a very kind person and always tries to support Momagul, but has been very unlucky and unable to earn a living, despite constant efforts. As years go by, the children are growing up and require more and more care, food, education, clothing, and modern technologies, all of which demand large sums of money. Momagul has decided to solve the family's financial problems through entrepreneurial activity that will bring her income. To this end, she took the course "Bring it On" organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained her graduation certificate.

Momagul would like to start her own business of buying and selling cattle, as she has experience in this line of work. She plans to use her profits to provide her children with quality education and nutritious food. She is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase cattle and launch her business. Momagul is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for starting her new business

loans.name: Chira

texts.fr: Madame Chira qui loge dans un village situé à environ 22 km de la ville principale fait du commerce de légumes depuis plus de 2 ans. Elle vient pour la 1ère fois solliciter un appui vers IMCEC pour  un financement de 150000F CFA avec lesquels elle va acheter des légumes (choux, oignons…) pour les revendre dans le marché local. Chira est mariée et  mère de famille c’est cela qui l’incite à participer à la dépense quotidienne du foyer. Elle aimerait un jour augmenter ses réserves afin de mieux gérer son commerce et avoir un fond plus solide.
texts.en: Madame Chira, who lives in a village approximately 22 km out of town, has sold vegetables for over two years. She is requesting her first loan from IMCEC for 150,000 F CFA. With it, she will buy vegetables (cabbages, onions...) for resale in the local market. Chira is a married mother; this is her motivation for contributing to the daily household expenses. She would like to expand her capital at some point in order to expand her business and have a more solid foundation.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (cabbages, onions) for re-sale.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en: Naome is 28 years old. She is the mother of two children, aged four and five. She runs a bar and now wants a loan to use to buy more crates of local brewery beers for sale. The profits from the business will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy crates of beers for sale.

loans.name: Vivotin Group

texts.fr: VIVOTIN est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, Léa Berth est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Léa Berth est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à André, un menuisier. Léa Berth a peu fréquenté l'école. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léa Berth et André vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Pour y parvenir, Léa Berth vend des condiments et divers produits dans sa boutique. Léa Berth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Léa Berth et les autres membres du groupe VIVOTIN sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Vivotin is a group of four people, who all engage in business. The representative of the group, Lea Berth, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. 

Lea Berth is 46 years old and is married to a man named Andre, a carpenter. The couple has two children, who they still care for and who have been to school. They live with their children, and together they take care of the different household expenses. Lea Berth has attended some school

To afford these expenses, Lea Berth sells condiments and other goods in her shop. She procures her goods from a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet the her and her children's needs without too much difficulty. 

Lea Berth and the other members of the Vivotin group are asking for the first time for financial assistance from Alidé in hopes to increase their working capital, expand their business, and respond better to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy condiments and other goods

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE est formé de trois personnes qui exercent des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Gisèle est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Gisèle est âgée de 46 ans et est mariée à Nicolas, un mécanicien. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Gisèle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Gisèle n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a environs six ans que Gisèle exerce comme activité, la vente des cartes de recharges et des bonbons à son domicile ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Gisèle désire renforcer son activité. Pour ce faire, Gisèle sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Missimide group is made up of three people, who all engage in business. The representative of this group, named Gisele, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. Gisele is 46 years old and is married to Nicolas, a mechanic. The couple has three children, who are all still under their care and who have been to school. Gisele lives together with her husband and children and ensures together with her husband that the different household expenses are met. Gisele has not been to school.

For about six years now, Gisele has been selling phone recharge cards and candy from her home. This allows her to meet the needs of her family without great difficulty. In order to better respond to the needs of her customers, Gisele wants to increase her level of business. To do this, Gisele, together with the other members of the Missimide group, are asking for their first loan with Alidé.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Murodvy

texts.ru: Муродви женщина с прекрасной душой и полной новыми идеями. Ее энергия и позитив  не позволяют ей оставаться на достигнутой. Она, всегда на поиске новшества. Ей 52 года, она замужем и имеет 4 детей. С молодости ее муж не зарабатывает достаточно денег и поэтому Муродви всегда старалась сама решить свои финансовые проблемы. Прошли годы, дети выросли, но Муродви вся в энергии и планирует организовать собственный бизнес. Она думает о возрасте, что для нее жизнь только начинается и открывает свои новые двери. «Мои года - мое богатство!» утверждает Муродви. С целью организовать свой бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  продуктовых товаров.  От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия проживания и реализовать новые планы. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2500 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Murodvy is a woman with a beautiful soul, who is full of novel ideas. Her positive energy does not let her rest on her accomplishments, and she is always on the lookout for something new. Murodvy is 52 years old, married, and has 4 children. Since his youth, her husband has not been able to earn enough money, and so Murodvy has always tried to solve her financial difficulties on her own. Years have passed, her children have grown up, but Murodvy remains full of energy and is now planning to launch her own business. She considers that at her age her life is only beginning and opening new doors for her. "My years are my wealth!" maintains Murodvy.

In order to start her own business, Murodvy took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is ready to engage in entrepreneurial activity and succeed in this new area. Murodvy would like to open her own grocery store. She is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni to purchase the necessary product for her new business. She is planning to use her profits to improve her living conditions and for future endeavours.

Murodvy is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products for her new grocery store

loans.name: Muminjon

texts.ru:
Муминчон проживает в районе Вахш. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. Муминчон живет с женой. Его дети маленькие. Муминчон на протяжении двенадцати лет работает таксистом. Он предоставляет услугу в районе Вахш. Также Муминчон развозит пассажиров по маршруту Кургантюбе-Душанбе. 
Муминчон берет кредит для ремонта автомашины и для установки оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Muminjon lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. He is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their small children. For the past twelve years, Muminjon has been working as a taxi driver throughout the Vakhsh region. He also transports passengers along the Kurgantube-Dushanbe route. Muminjon is taking this loan to repair his vehicle and to convert it to natural gas.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and convert it to natural gas

loans.name: Mahuna Group

texts.fr: MAHUNA est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village. La représentante du groupe, Louise est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Louise est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à un certain Séraphin. Louise n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec leurs enfants et assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis trois années environs, Louise vend des cartes de recharges à son domicile. Louise s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir sans grande difficulté, à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Louise et les autres membres du groupe MAHUNA sollicitent pour une première fois, l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Mahuna is a group of three people who all live in the same village. The representative of the group, Louise, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. 

Louise is 37 years old and is married to a man named Seraphin. Louise has not been to school. The couple has four children, who are all still under their care and who have been to school. The couple lives together with their children and ensures together that the different household expenses are met. 

For about three years, Louise has been selling phone recharge cards from her home. She procures her goods from an area in Benin. This business allows her to meet her and her children's needs without great difficulty. 

Louise and the other members of the Mahuna group are asking for the first time for financial assistance from Alidé in order to increase their working capital and their business and to better respond to the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Daphrose

texts.en:
Daphrose is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, between 7 and 11 years old. Daphrose sells clothes and has been in this business for about twelve years. She keeps her business open from 8 am until 8 pm every day with two people to help her.  

Daphrose needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Daphrose will purchase different styles of clothes to sell in her business. With this loan, she hopes to earn more profit, which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and to pay children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase different styles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Paul Loko

texts.fr: Paul Loko est âgé de 57 ans et vit au Bénin. Paul Loko n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Paul Loko est marié à un certain Mahoussi. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent à leur charge. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Paul Loko mène comme activité, la profession de meunier depuis une vingtaine d'années à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Paul Loko vend des fagots de bois. Paul Loko s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Paul Loko sollicite pour la cinquième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d'accroître son revenu en vue de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Paul Loko, age 57, lives in Benin. He never attended school. He is married to Mahoussi. The couple have seven children who have all received schooling. 
Two of them are still in the couple’s care. To provide for the family’s needs, Paul Loko has been working as a grain miller from his home for about twenty years. He also sells bundles of wood as a secondary activity. He buys his stock in a region of Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction, and to increase his sales and revenue, Paul Loko is seeking a fifth loan from ALIDé. This credit will help him to bolster his activity and income, which should result in a boost in profits. All past loans were correctly repaid

loans.use: to buy bundles of wood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Alexie

texts.en: Alexie is 33. She is married and sells charcoal. She wants the loan to add sacks of charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used for making savings.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Akpedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AKPEDJI est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne Rufine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne Rufine est âgée de 51 ans et est une veuve. Julienne Rufine a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Julienne Rufine a peu fréquenté l’école. Julienne Rufine vit seule avec ses enfants et supporte seule les diverses charges. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de sa famille, Julienne Rufine vend depuis vingt ans, divers produits dans un marché du Bénin. Julienne Rufine s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin.
