Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses charges. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Julienne Rufine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AKPEDJI. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AKPEDJI group is comprised of three friends. This is the third time that the group is asking for financial support from ALIDé in order to grow their business. 

Julienne Rufine (with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative. She is 51 and a widow. While Julienne Rufine barely attended school, she has four children who all go to school. She lives with her children and is the sole provider for their various expenses.

In order to contribute to the needs of her family, Julienne Rufine has been selling various products in a market in Benin for 20 years. She buys her supplies in a market in Benin. This business allows her to meet her needs without great difficulty. 

With the goal of the satisfaction of her clients, and in order to grow her sales volume and revenue, Julienne Rufine is asking for a third loan with ALIDé along with the other members of the AKPEDJI group. Their previous loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: to buy various products.

loans.name: Badengnadjourou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  BADENGNADJOUROU  sont essentiellement des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques au quartier Babemba un des nouveaux quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur neuvième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  ROKIA fait le commerce  des habits  dans ce groupe de femmes de   BADENGNADJOUROU  elle se tient en deuxième position de   la droite vers  la gauche. 
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 15 pièces de pagne wax et 5 pièces de bazin moyen riche qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.500FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the Badengnadjourou group are mainly married women with an average age of 39, and have an average of five children. The majority of them live in monogamous families in Babemba, a new neighborhood in the city of Sikasso, the third-largest administrative region in Mali. They are on their ninth loan with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, and aim to satisfy their customers' requests. 

Rokia works selling clothing, and is pictured standing second from right to left with the rest of the Badengnadjourou group members.  She plans to buy 15 lengths of pagne [traditional wrap-around cloth] made using traditional wax methods and five lengths of medium rich damask with her loan, which she will resell on a cash basis on site and from home, to a clientele mainly comprised of women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,500 francs CFA, part of which will be used to pay the interest on her loan and the rest will be saved.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is 32 years old. She is married to a motorist and they have two children. They all go to school. She owns a bar and she is currently running a bar. With the loan, she wants to buy more beer, soda and mineral water to sell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings for a better future.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda and mineral water for sale.

loans.name: Nyadzuwa

texts.en: Nyadzuwa is a 40 year old married woman. She describes herself to be a business-oriented woman. She operates a retail business, where she sells firewood. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a highly-populated area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of firewood to sell. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy firewood to sell. Her business goal is to open a new retail shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is home to the main campus of Moi University. She has four children.

She is a farmer and has been doing this work for 30 years. Her primary income sources are milk, crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Gardening!" Her biggest challenge is "finding market for farm produce in distant areas since the local markets provide poor prices." The animals in her farm are not named. 

She will use the loan to construct a dairy unit (a housing unit with two sections with one part used for feeding the animals and the other part as a sleeping area) for her animals.

Pamela was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "Other farmers have succeeded through Juhudi Kilimo."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "How to do farming as business."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Pamela replied, "Assist in paying fees."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Pamela owns the following: cow, bicycle, automobile, but does not own pig, poultry, pump, motorcycle. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net, TV but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a dairy cow housing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-two years old and a farmer from Nkubu County in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children, all of whom are in school. She is a teacher by profession.

She has been in farming for fifteen years. She produces milk, tea, and bananas, which she sells locally. She has made a loan request amounting to 50,000 KES which she will use to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming as well. Her future plans however is to do commercial dairy farming after gaining good skills in farming dealing with the domestic animals especially poultry and dairy cows. She emphasizes the loan will generate more income through the diversification of her farming and will help in educating her children.

She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo for efficient services to farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 28 years old. He is a very hardworking man. He has been married to one wife and they have a beautiful child whom they constantly make efforts for. They live in the town of Kaloleni.

Daniel has been a motorcycle taxi driver for four years. He has told us that his job is demanding but he likes it very much because through this job he can support his wife and his child. He dreams of buying another motorcycle taxi.  The loan will enable him buy spare parts and service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and do general servicing of his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Turguntosh

texts.ru:
Женщина с банальной целью организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Тургунтош и ей 28 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж простой рабочий и его доход не позволяет обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Тургунтош надеялась на мужа и нигде не работала, а условия проживания год за годом ухудшается. Она не может больше надеется на мужа. Итак, она собралась с мыслями организовать бизнес с выращиванием сельхоз культур, как картошка, морковь, лук, зерновые культуры и т.п. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
A woman, with a simple goal of starting her own business and becoming successful, needs your support. Her name is Turguntosh and she is 28 years old. She is married and has 3 children in her care. Her husband is a simple labourer, and his income does not allow him to provide his family with all necessities of life. Turguntosh had placed all her hopes in her husband and didn't find a job herself, but year after year their living conditions worsened. Turguntosh can no longer depend only on her husband, and has decided to start her own business cultivating crops such as potatoes, carrots, onions, grains etc. To this end, she took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is quite capable of setting up her own business and becoming successful. Turguntosh is planning to use her profits to provide her children with quality education and nutritious food.

Turguntosh is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for launching her new business

loans.name: Ankadignonyé Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe  Ankadignonyé sont mariées  majoritairement dans des ménages polygamiques avec  en moyenne 58 ans et 4 enfants par femme. Elles habitent toutes dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Elles font le petit commerce de céréales (mil, niébé et riz), condiments (Sounbala : condiment à base de grains de néré) et des ustensiles plastiques. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont adhéré au programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui elles sont à leur 15ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Soungoura (femme debout en 2ème position de la  droite  vers la  gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des céréales dans sa localité et ses environs. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de riz. Elle se ravitaille en céréales avec les forains au grand marché. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame   Soungoura espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants du foyer.
texts.en:
The six women of the Ankadignonyé Group are married, most of them in polygamous households, and average 58 years of age and four children per woman. They all live in Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) and met through neighborhood, family and marriage ties. They have a small business selling cereals (millet, black-eyed peas and rice), condiments (soumbala, a condiment [fermented mash, a source of protein] made from néré tree seeds) and plastic utensils.

With the goal of increasing their business, the group members joined Soro Yiriwaso's loan program, through which they are on their 15th group loan cycle.

Mrs. Soungoura (the woman standing second to the right from the left side of the photo) is well-known for her sale of cereals in her neighborhood and surrounds. She plans to use her loan to purchase five sacks of rice. She obtains her supply of cereals from the fairgrounds at the grand market. Her sales are made for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women. With this loan, Mrs. Soungoura hopes to see a monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be used as a reinvestment in the business and to see to the upkeep of the children at home.

loans.use: To purchase rice.

loans.name: Norgul

texts.ru: Норгулу 47 лет. Она замужем, но не имеет детей. Ее муж Шокуват простой рабочий и получает маленькую зарплату. Она старается решить все свои финансовые проблемы сама. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей скота. Ее заботливый муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия проживания.  Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Norgul is 47 years old. She is married but has no children. Her husband Shokuvat is a simple labourer and earns a small salary, and so Norgul tries to solve all her financial difficulties on her own. To this end, she took the course "Bring It On", organized by the Association of Business Women, and earned her graduation certificate. Now she is quite ready to launch her own business and succeed.

Norgul would like to focus her business on buying and selling cattle. Her caring husband will help her in this endeavour. Norgul is requesting a loan of 5000 somoni to purchase cattle and launch her enterprise. She plans to use her profits to improve her living conditions, and is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle for launching her new business

loans.name: Dagobert

texts.fr: Dagobert est un homme de 32 ans célibataire père d'un enfant de 2 ans. Il est commerçant et a ouvert dans un quartier de la capitale une salle de jeux depuis 3 ans. elle foncdtionne bien grâce à son acceuil chaleureux, ses bonnes relations avec son voisage et son expérience dans ce domaine. Ce qui lui a permis d'augmenter sa clientèle au fil du temps. Il sollicite ce crédit pour ajouter de nouvelles machines (playstation) pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices générés par ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité  et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dagobert is a 32-year-old man.  He is single and the father of a 2-year-old child.  He works in small business, and three years ago, he opened a game room in one of the neighborhoods of the capital city.

Dagobert's business is doing well thanks to his warm welcome, to his friendly relationships with his neighbors, and to his good experience in this field.  Over time, Dagobert has managed to attract a larger group of customers.

He is requesting this loan to purchase new PlayStation consoles, which will help him to better meet his customers' needs.

Part of the profits from his business will be reinvested in the business, while the rest will be used to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy new PlayStation game consoles.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a father of three children, and has been practicing mixed farming in his rural home in Kisii, with his major produce being vegetables, maize, milk, sorghum and beans. He runs his farm with the help of one farmhand. He gets additional income from a motorcycle transport business, which mainly helps farmers make delivery of produce to the market.

Hasan has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to use in setting up a dairy unit for his dairy cows. He believes this will give better protection to the animals and mitigate the challenges of diseases arising from poor housing. He says good development of dairy farming could help improve the family living standards and educate his children.

Hasan is focusing on gradual improvement of the dairy farming as his core business. He remains optimistic that he will be able to meet his family needs with more ease in future.

loans.use: To construct a dairy unit

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata  est âgée de 50 ans,  mariée et mère de 7 enfants, elle loge chez son mari dans une famille nucléaire dans la ville de Markala dans la quatrième région administrative du Mali, Ségou.
 N’ayant pas été à l’école, elle fut mariée très tôt, alors elle commença à faire le petit commerce de céréales qu’elle a appris auprès de sa maman à l’enfance. Elle effectue ce petit commerce depuis plus de 30 ans et jouit d’une grande réputation.   
Dans le but d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour satisfaire la  demande de la clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle a fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis plus de 4 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé 9 prêts solidaires, elle est à son 1er  cycle de prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 30 sacs de mil. Elle s’approvisionne avec les producteurs de céréales. 
Madame Aminata vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA, qui serait  utilisé pour prendre en charge les petits besoins du foyer. Elle a pour objectif de devenir grossiste dans la vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is 50 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives with her husband in a nuclear family in the town of Markala in Mali's fourth administrative region, Ségou.

Not having attended school, Mrs. Aminata was married very young, and began a small business selling cereals, which she learned from her mother during her childhood. She has been running this small business for more than 30 years and benefits from an excellent reputation.

With the goal of increasing her business in order to meet rising customer demand, she joined Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she has been involved for more than four years. Having properly repaid nine group loans, Mrs. Aminata is on her first individual loan, which she plans to use to purchase 30 sacks of millet. She gets her supplies from  cereal producers.

Mrs. Aminata sells [her wares] for cash and credit to a group of customers made up of men and women. She hopes to see an average monthly profit of 50,000 CFA francs, which would be used to provide for minor household supplies. Her goal is to become a wholesaler of cereals.

loans.use: To purchase millet.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 69-year-old farmer in Kitale, Kenya, where she lives. She has two children who have both cleared school. She is widowed and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 44 years, producing maize, beans, and potatoes, which she sells to the people around her local area. For an additional source of income, she works as an herbal medicine administrator.

Mariam has made a loan request amounting to 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her buy and insure a dairy cow. She says the income will help with her family upkeep. She remains optimistic she will be able to run farming business more professionally after gaining more skills and getting more training with time.

Mariam however mentions poor infrastructure and animal diseases as the major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, se creó por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación,  el grupo se encuentra en el 11º ciclo, trabaja desde el año 2006, y quiere seguir creciendo.
La Sra. María es parte de este desafío,  ella tiene 2 hijos está acompañada con el Sr. Michel y ella se dedica hace varios años como comerciante, donde vende todo tipo de productos, ya que tiene muy buena venta, ya que siempre da muy buena variedad a sus clientes y eso les gusta mucho.
Maria Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas y demás insumos para poder seguir abasteciendo su negocio y seguir dando la variedad a la que están acostumbrados. Todas las señoras del grupo también  realizan actividades productivas de todo tipo y de esa forma ayudan a sus miembros.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encarnación and was started as a result of one of its members contacting Fundación Paraguaya. The group is in its 11th loan cycle and has been working since 2006. They want to continue growing.

Sra. Maria took up this challenge. She is married to Sr. Michel and they have two children. Maria has been a merchant for many years, selling all types of products. She has very good sales since she always offers a good variety to her customers, who very much enjoy having this option.

Maria is requesting a loan so that she can buy fabrics and other supplies in order to restock her business and continue providing the variety that her customers are accustomed to having. All of the women in this group engage in various productive activities that allow them to help themselves.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies.

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.es: Doña Rubenia, tiene 58 años de edad, casada, vive en el municipio de santa cruz de Yojoa, Cortes junto a su esposo e hija, quienes le apoyan en el negocio. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de condimentos y ya hace 6 años que decidió por establecer una tiendita para vender sandalias de todo tipo, ropa nueva para damas y caballeros y variedad de cosméticos. Su negocio tiene buena demanda y tiene buena clientela. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar más producto que le hace falta como ropa nueva y sandalias, el cual es por 3,000 Lempiras. Ella tiene como plan seguir incrementando el inventario de mercadería para aumentar las ganancias y poder tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
Doña Rubenia is 58 years old, married, and lives with her husband and daughter in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Her family helps with her business.

Rubenia previously sold condiments, but she decided to open a small shop six years ago so that she could sell all types of sandals, new clothing for women and men, and a variety of cosmetics. Her business experiences high demand and has a good clientele. The loan she is requesting in the amount of 3,000 HNL will be used to buy more products that she is lacking, such as new clothes and sandals.

Rubenia has plans to keep growing her inventory of merchandise so that she can increase her earnings and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients to prepare meals for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a course in her degree plan.

loans.name: Kuña Pora Group

texts.es:
El comité está en su segundo ciclo y está luchando por seguir y crecer más día a día. Podemos hablar de la Sra. Isabel quien se dedica a la compra – venta de ropas, sábanas, edredones y aparte realiza trabajo de cotillón, tiene  2 hijos, está casada.
Como se puede ver ella es una persona que hace de todo por poder ayudar a su marido en los gastos que tienen en la casa, es por eso que se esfuerza y por sus hijos, ya que quiere poder darles todo lo que necesitan para que estudien y el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, edredones, y artículos de cotillón, lo cual le ayudará mucho en su trabajo y seguirá creciendo.
texts.en:
This committee is in its second loan cycle and is striving to keep growing each day. Sra. Isabel was the member who was interviewed. She buys and sells clothing, bed sheets, and comforters in addition to managing a party supply business. Isabel is married and has two children.

Isabel is the type of person who tries to do everything she can to help her husband with the household expenses. For this reason, she puts forth her best effort on behalf of her children so that she can provide them everything they need for their studies and help them become good people in the future.

Isabel is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing, comforters, and party supplies. This will be a great help to her business and allow her to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy clothing, comforters, and party supplies.

loans.name: Abdourahmane

texts.fr: Abdourahmane est un jeune célibataire.Il est employé comme chauffeur de taxi. Le salaire qu'il perçoit ne lui permet pas de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Ainsi a - t il épargné afin de pouvoir acheter son propre taxi. Il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 500 000f pour compléter le moment épargné et acheter un taxi neuf.
texts.en: Abdourahmane is a young single person. He works as a taxi driver. The salary he receives does not allow him to support his family. So, he has been saving up to buy his own taxi. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs through UIMCEC to add to his savings [so he can] buy a new taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Madame Adama est une femme mariée qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plus de 20 ans dans le secteur des services et fait de la photographie.  Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC  ou elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’un nouvel appareil photo. Son objectif est de diversifier les services qu’elle offre a sa clientèle. Elle souhaite aussi mieux rentabiliser son activité afin d’accroitre les revenus qui lui sont procurés.
-
texts.en:
Adama is a married woman who lives in Senegal. She has worked for more than 20 years in the service industry doing photography. She is a member of one of the UIMCEC branches, where she is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to buy a new camera. 

Her goal is to diversify the services that she offers her customers. She would also like to make her business more profitable in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy a camera

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un homme marié.Il est père de cinq enfants. Il tient un magasin de distribution d’œuf et d'aliments de poule.Ses revenus lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins alimentaires, sanitaires de sa famille. Afin de renforcer son stock, il sollicite un pret de 500 000f pour acheter des tablettes d’œufs et des aliments.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a married man and a father of five children. He has a distribution store of eggs and chicken feed. His income allows him to support the food and health needs of his family. 

In order to increase his stock, he is asking for a loan of 500,000 francs to buy trays of eggs and feed.

loans.use: to buy eggs and chicken feed

loans.name: Fatou  Sylla

texts.fr: Fatou  est un jeune célibataire qui tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmétiques et de cartes de recharge téléphoniques.Elle parvient à générer des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100 000f pour acheter des produits cosmétiques et des cartes de recharges de crédits téléphone.
texts.en:
Fatou is a young single woman who has a boutique selling cosmetics and phone recharge cards. She earns enough income to support her needs. 

In order to increase her business capital, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy cosmetics and phone recharge cards.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and phone recharge cards

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Маруфчон проживает в районе Бохтар. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Маруфчон вместе с женой занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где занимается продажей детской и подростковой обуви. Торговлей Маруфчон занимается уже несколько лет. Он берет кредит для покупки зимней обуви.
texts.en: Marufjon lives in the Bohtar region of Tajikistan. He is 30 years old, married, and has four children. Together with his wife, Marufjon sells shoes for children and teenagers from a retail spot he rents at the market. Marufjon has been in retail for several years. He is taking this loan to purchase winter footwear.

loans.use: to buy winter footwear

loans.name: Diatou

texts.fr: Madame Diatou est une femme mariée qui évolue  dans le secteur du commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elle s’active dans la vente de poissons et les bénéfices que lui procure son activité lui permettent d’entretenir ses 6 enfants. Son objectif aussi est de développer son activité afin de parvenir à augmenter son fond de roulement. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’UIMCEC et sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de poissons à revendre.
texts.en:
Diatou is a married woman who has been in the commercial industry for more than 20 years. She sells fish, and the profits that she makes allows her to support her six children. 

She also has the goal of developing her business in order to increase her working capital. She is a member of a UIMCEC branch and requests a loan of 300,000 francs to buy fish to resell.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.ru: Шарофату 57 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Шарофату  и ее мужу очень трудно справляться с обеспечением семьи, так как у них доход очень маленький. Хотя дети уже выросли, но они не в состоянии содержать себя. Шарофат решила организовать новый бизнес, с целью обеспечения семьи. Ее муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. Она обучилась на курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  продуктовых товаров. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  1000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sharofat is 57 years old. She is married and has 5 children in her care. Sharofat and her husband are having difficulties providing for their family due to their low incomes. While the children are grown-up, they are not yet able to support themselves. 

Sharofat has decided to start her own business, with her husband's assistance, in order to better support her family. She took the course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained her graduation certificate. Now she is fully ready to launch her business and succeed in this new venture. She would like to open her own grocery store, and is requesting a loan of 1000 somoni to stock up on food products before launch. Sharofat is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy food products and launch her new grocery store

loans.name: Naboti Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nirere, leader du groupe d’affaire «Naboti », est  une jeune entrepreneur, âgée d'environ 28  ans, mariée, mère de 2 jeunes enfants. Son mari est un enseignant. Elle est  vendeuse de souliers. Il y a plus 3 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  6eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  25 paires de souliers.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir confortablement  et acheter une parcelle.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nirere, the leader of the business group "Naboti", is a young entrepreneur, about 28 years old, married and the mother of 2 young children. Her husband is a teacher. She sells shoes and has been performing this revenue-generating activity for over 3 years.

She has just received her 6th loan from Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy 25 pairs of shoes. She would also like to watch her children grow up comfortably and buy a plot of land.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in aid of impoverished women excluded from regular bank lending channels.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorela maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory of boxes of tomatoes.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.ru:
Анжела с 2008 года арендует на рынке помещение под парикмахерскую. В своем салоне она делает стрижки и укладки. На этом рынке это единственная парикмахерская, цены невысокие, многим удобно это месторасположение. К тому же парикмахерская Анжелы работает допоздна. 
Анжеле потребовалась дополнительная сумма в размере 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы сделать ремонт в своей парикмахерской, тем самым облагородив ее, и установить там бойлер. Дополнительную прибыль, полученную от реализации кредитных средств, Анжела надеется потратить на улучшение качества жизни своей семьи.
texts.en:
Since 2008, Anzhela has been renting space at the market and operating a hair salon, where she offers haircuts and styling. This is the market's only hair salon, her prices are reasonable, and the location is convenient for many clients. Plus, Anzhela's salon stays open late at night.

Anzhela needs additional funds in the amount of 12,000 hryvnia in order to carry out repairs in the salon, thereby improving its appearance, as well as to install a boiler there. Anzhela plans to spend the additional profits she will earn thanks to this loan on improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out repairs in her hair salon

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Elisabeth est une femme âgée de 47 ans veuve et mère de famille. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend les vivres frais(tomates, oignons)en fonction des saisons depuis 20 ans déjà.C'est grace à cette activité qu'elle subvient aux besoins de sa famille. La longue expérience dans ce domaine, la bonne connaissance de ses fournisseurs lui permet d'acheter à de bon prix pour pouvoir ameliorer son activité. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ses vivres à savoir les cajots de tomates. les bénéfices générés par ce crédit lui permettront d'agrandir son activité et éconiser le reste pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille dont elle en a la charge et économiser leur scolarité .
texts.en:
Elisabeth is a 47-year-old woman, a widow, and a mother. She has been a merchant in a local market for 20 years, where she sells fresh food (tomatoes, onions) according to the seasons. Thanks to this business, she can support the needs of her family. 

Her long experience in this area and her good acquaintance with food suppliers allow her he to buy at a good price which enables her to improve her business. 

She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of these fresh food items, i.e., crates of tomatoes. The income from this loan will allow her to increase her business. The rest she will save to support her family and their schooling.

loans.use: to increase her stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 56 years old and married with ten children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Zosima has a business making concrete blocks in the Philippines. Zosima requested a 50000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for this business.

Zosima has been in this business for twenty-five years. In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making concrete blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages for his shop.

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
This is Carolyn, She previously accessed an 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 22,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy grocery items and toiletries needed in her variety store. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay for the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Carolyn hopes that her business will continue to mature and be successful and dreams of providing her children with a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira, leader du groupe d’affaire «Utulivu », est  senior entrepreneur, âgée de 56  ans, veuve, mère de 6 jeunes enfants et de nombreux  petits fils et filles. Son mari fut décédé  suite d’une longue maladie chronique. Elle est  vendeuse de farine de maniocs dans un dépôt agricole au centre commercial de Birere. Il y a 15 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir   son 19eme crédit auprès de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  40 sacs de maniocs. En plus, elle souhaite  voir ses enfants grandir  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes  veuves exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kavira, the leader of the business group "Utulivu", is an older entrepreneur, 56 years old, widowed and the mother of 6 children and numerous grandsons and granddaughters. Her husband died after a long, chronic illness. She sells cassava flour at an agricultural depot in the commercial centre of Birere. She has been doing these types of small (revenue-generating) activities for 15 years.

She has just received her 19th loan from MFI Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy 40 bags of cassavas. She would also like to watch her children grow and increase her business.

The customer thanks Hekima for its actions in aid of poor widowed women excluded by classic banks.

loans.use: to buy 40 bags of cassava flour.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 33 years old, married and has 2 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Lilibeth has a food market business in the Philippines. She requested a 15000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her food stall.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lilibeth would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorela maintenance.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla, who previously accessed a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her child's education as well as in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Perla is requesting another 25,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits, profits that will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Perla hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to send her child all the way to college. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rolina

texts.en:
Rolina is 35 years old, married, and has eight children.  She presently resides in Caticugan, Siquijor, Siquijor.  She had been in the fishing business for 20 years. 

Rolina is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which he will use to purchase fishing net materials.  She had been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jocelyn's Group

texts.en:
Jocelyn, a 34-year-old married mother of one, lives in Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental where she sells charcoal, earning approximately PHP 10,000.00 each month. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to resell. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to expand her business.

Jocelyn is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Hambardzum

texts.en:
Hambardzum lives in Yerevan with his parents and sister. Hambardzum studies at Yerevan State University. He is in the second course at the Faculty of International Relations. 

Hambardzum works as a barber at a hairdressing salon, but the salary does not allow him to save sufficient funds for education. Hambardzum has applied for this loan of AMD 200000 to pay his university fee for the first semester. 

Higher education is very important for Hambardzum to find a more profitable job in the future, and to sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay tuition for the first semester of the second course

loans.name: Vitalyi

texts.ru:
Виталий уже не первый раз обращается за кредитной помощью к КИВА. В прошлый раз за счет вложения полученной от КИВА суммы в ходовой товар, Виталий смог увеличить свой доход и помочь семье финансово. Совсем недавно у него родились девочки-двойняшки – теперь в семье расходы увеличились вдвое. 
Виталий надеется вложить сумму в 10 000 гривен в приобретение дополнительной партии парфюмерной продукции в преддверии Новогодних и Рождественских праздников, когда хорошим спросом пользуется подарочная продукция и всегда быстро расходится.
texts.en:
This is not the first time Vitalyi is turning to Kiva for financial help. Last time, thanks to investing his Kiva loan into purchasing popular merchandise, he was able to increase his profits and improve his family's financial situation. Just recently, Vitalyi became a father of twin daughters - now their family's expenses have grown two-fold.

Vitalyi hopes to invest the sum of 10,000 hryvnia into a purchase of an additional shipment of perfumes and cosmetics in advance of the Christmas and New Year's holidays, when gift packs are in demand and always sell quickly.

loans.use: to purchase an additional shipment of perfumes in time for the holidays

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 66 years old and lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. She is married with six children. 

Lucia is engaged in a vegetable vending business and earns approximately 5,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional vegetables for sale.
 
Lucia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Lucia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables.

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: Madame Nzigire est une présidente dynamique du groupe Heshima. Mariée à un homme d’affaire est mere de 11 enfants  tous scolarisés à 50 ans. Elle est vendeuse de farine, savon, sucre et riz depuis sa jeunesse ainsi elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner. Elle remercie Hekima de la soutenir et souhaite construire une maison d’habitation dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Nzigire is an active president of the Heshima group. She is 50 years old, married to a business man, and mother of 11 children, all of whom have received schooling.

She has been selling flour, soap, sugar, and rice since she was a girl. She is seeking this loan in order to use it to stock up on goods.

She would like to thank Hekima for supporting her. In the future, she wants to build a house to live in.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of flour, 1 box of soap, 1 bag of sugar and rice

loans.name: Vasiliy

texts.ru:
Василий живет и работает в городе Запорожье. Он работает на одном из самых крупных рынков города, арендует два прилавка. Торгует электротоварами, лампочками, батарейками, термосами, радио, фонариками и прочим. Василий работает в этом бизнесе уже 5 лет. 
Василий планирует использовать кредит КИВА в размере 12 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить гирлянды и электротовары в преддверии Нового года в качестве расширения своей товарной базы. Василий планирует развиваться в своем направлении, со временем хочет поставить еще одну точку для продаж.
texts.en:
Vasiliy lives and works in the city of Zaporozhye. He works at one of the city's largest markets, where he rents two retail spots. Vasiliy sells electrical goods, lightbulbs, batteries, thermoses, radios, flashlights etc. He has been in this business for the past 5 years.

Vasiliy plans to use this Kiva loan of 12,000 hryvnia to purchase Christmas lights and electrical equipment in time for New Year in order to expand his merchandise range. He plans to continue developing his business and, in time, add another retail location.

loans.use: to purchase Christmas lights and electrical goods prior to New Year in order to expand the assortment of his merchandise

loans.name: Nelvin

texts.en:
Nelvin is 26 years old, married, and lives in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City. He is a motorcab operator and earns approximately 15,000 PHP  each month. 

Nelvin is requesting a loan, which he will use to purchase equipment to repair his motorcycle.  He has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Nelvin hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 46 years old and lives in Carmen, Jimenez,  Misamis Occidental. He is married with five children. 

Ricardo is engaged in a lumber cutting and selling business and earns approximately 7,000.00 PHP (Philippines pesos) each month doing this type of work. 

He has requested a loan to be used in paying for the logs and lumber, labor and other expenses in cutting lumber for his existing business. 

Ricardo became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Ricardo hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To pay for logs and lumber, labor and other expenses

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married.  Marilou is 39 years old and lives in Villa C. Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Marilou sells cosmetic products to earn a living and has had this business for 1 year.  Each month, she earns PHP 1,000 doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase more cosmetics products.

Marilou has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Marilou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics products

location.town: Liloy-Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is married with 1 child. Geraldine is 29 years old and lives in Farmington,Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Geraldine sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years.  She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more raw ingredients for snacks.

Geraldine has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Geraldine hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for snacks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is taking out a new loan to invest in his retail shop.  Thanks to the previous loan that enabled him to keep save some money which allowed him to open a small store. 

With this loan, he plans to buy stocks of wheat and maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.  He also testifies that the previous loan transformed his living standards to a more improved life.

loans.use: to buy stock of wheat and maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is married and has three children. Maribel is 34 years old and lives in Baybay, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Maribel sells dried fish to earn a living and had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 to buy more dried fish to sell.

Maribel has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Maribel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is married and has three children. Estela is 38 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Estela sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase more dried fish to sell.

Estela has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Estela hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Santas

texts.en:
Santas is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Santas works hard to support her family.

Santas requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials for her business.

Santas has been in this business for 15 years now, and she also earns additional income by fattening pigs and running a general store.

In the future, Santas would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga tiene 40 años de edad es soltera tiene una hija, vive con la madre y con la hija en Guaranda sector Cuatro esquinas Provincia de Bolívar.

LA VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central está formada por 12 socios que pertenecen al sector cuatro esquinas, los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades como son agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio y otros.

María Olga se dedica a al crianza de animales cómo pollos, cerdos y la agricultura  siembra papas, maíz.

Las compras y las ventas los realiza en Guaranda, Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, pollos, cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito le ayudaría a tener otros ingresos. El sueño es poder incrementar el negocio.

Los desafíos a los que se presenta es la competencia. En los tiempos libres le gusta descansar y disfrutar de las festividades de la navidad.
texts.en:
María Olga is 40 years old, single and has one daughter. She lives with her mother and daughter in the town of Cuatro Esquinas, Guaranda, Bolivar Province. 

The Central Cuatro Esquinas Communal Bank is made up of 12 members who come from Cuatro Esquinas. The members are involved in various trades such as agriculture, raising animals, trade and others. 

María Olga raises animals such as chickens and pigs as well as agriculture as she sows potatoes and corn. 

She buys and sells in the city of Guaranda. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, chickens and pigs. This loan would help her bring in more income. Her dream is to be able to expand the business.

Her biggest challenge is competition. In her free time she likes to relax and enjoy Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, chickens and pigs

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus is married with 1 child.  Jesus is 33 years old and lives in Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Jesus is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living.  He has been doing this for 2 years.  He has requested for a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer.

Jesus has been a member of PMPC for this year.  In the future, Jesus hopes to expand his rice field

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes  is married with 2 children.  Lourdes  is 29 years old and lives in ZNAC,Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Lourdes sells food for snacks to earn a living and has had this business for 5 months.  She has requested a loan of  PHP10,000 for additional capital.

Lourdes  has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Lourdes  hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: for additional capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Eladio Manuel

texts.es: Eladio  de 36 años de edad, empezó su negocio hace menos de 2 años teniendo en cuenta las necesidades de su barrio en cuanto a señalización y nomenclatura, de la cual él se encargó y empezó a ganar dinero; hoy  con este negocio ha avanzado, pues agregó otras alternativas de ventas como cuadros en lienzo y accesorios de cerámica, los cuales vende puerta a puerta, unas veces de contado y otras veces a crédito, con una frecuencia diaria durante 8 horas cada dia. Su propósito futuro  es lograr  liderazgo a  nivel nacional y para eso desarrolla un trabajo con eficiencia y mucha responsabilidad. En  actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará madera y biscochos de cerámica, además de cuadros, productos con los cuales mantendrá un inventario para sus clientes y aumentará su potencial de ventas en un mercado que diariamente crece. Esta es justamente la  razón de éxito, de la inversión de su credikiva al que ahora aplica.
texts.en: Eladio is 36 years old. He started his business less than 2 years ago, taking into account the needs of his neighborhood for name and house number signs. He took charge of this and began to earn money. Today he has advanced with this business, since he has added alternative items for sale such as paintings on canvas and decorative ceramic items, which he sells door to door, sometimes for cash and other times on credit, working every day, 8 hours a day. His plan for the future is to achieve leadership on the national level, and for this he is working with efficiency and great responsibility. Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, his first financing with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. He will use it to buy wood and ceramic bisque items, in addition to paintings. With these products he will maintain an inventory for his customers and will increase his potential sales in a market that is increasing each day. This is precisely his plan for success from the investment of the Kiva loan for which he is now applying.

loans.use: to buy wood, ceramic figurines and paintings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira is 40 years old, married and a mother to seven children. 

She has been buying and selling livestock for several years, a business that supports her family with its basic everyday needs. 

Despite starting her business with just a few goats, she has slowly built it through hard work. Her sales continue to grow. 

She doesn't have enough money to expand, so she is applying for a loan to buy five goats and pay for labor cost to take them to the market. 

She dreams of having a large business that generates more income and a good life for herself and her family and provides for a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy five goats and pay for labor cost.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is married and has two children. Trinidad is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Trinidad is a farmer who grows hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for six years. 

She has requested a loan of 2,000 PHP to purchase more feeds for her pigs.

Trinidad has been a member of PMPC during this year. In the future, Trinidad hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita is 52 years old and lives in Mialem, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependent. 

Purita has a store where she sells groceries and other consumable products and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing groceries and other consumable products for her business.

Purita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Purita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries and other consumable products to sell.

loans.name: Monhtuya

texts.en:
Monhtuya is 34 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in a ger (a traditional yurt) in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband, Batmunh, works in a private construction company as an assistant worker. Her daughter, Bolortsetseg, age of 14, is a secondary school student. 

Monhtuya has been running a business of organic vegetable sales in the local food market for seven years. She is a diligent, hardworking and responsible woman. She has gained a lot of experience in the organic vegetable sales business. 

She is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to reserve a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rental counter at the local food market.

loans.use: to reserve a large amount of organic vegetables to sell in her rental counter at the local food market.

loans.name: Bintiomari

texts.en:
Bintiomari is without a doubt a brave, hardworking woman; she says she’s humble, honest and tenacious and that she loves her family.  She is a widowed mother of six children.  What’s important for her is to move her family forward. 

Bintiomari operates as kiosk where she sells basic household items and also stocks vegetables for sell.  The loan she’s asked  Yehu for is to buy instant goods and more vegetables to sell.  Her dream is to see her children become professionals and have a prosperous life some day. 

She’s aware that she can reach her dream but must work to do so which is why everyday she gets up thanking God for one more day of life in which she can work to reach her dream.

loans.use: to buy instant goods and more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 55 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.  She is married and has 3 children.

Jessie is engaged in services particularly in beauty parlor business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional accessories and for the improvement of her existing parlor business.

Jessie has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Jessie hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional accessories

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 51 year old, widow who lives in Tangub City having 3 children.  She earns a living through food and home used products vending. 

She has been doing this business for 20 years and earns PHP 3,000 a month from this work.  Juanita has applied for a loan of PHP 4,500 at GDMPC to purchase new items such as candies, snack foods, etc. 

She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  She hopes to improve the general living conditions of the her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, snack foods, etc

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a forty-two year farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where she lives with her husband and three children, who are all in school. She has been farming for over twenty years, producing tea, milk, peas, vegetables and beans that she sells in the local market.

She is requesting a 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a chaff cutter, which will help her to prepare enough feed for her dairy cows, and thus to produce more milk and increase her income, so that she can improve her standard of living and pay for her children's school fees. 

High costs of feed and the small size of her piece of land are her major challenges in farming.

Rosemary is grateful for the assistance that Juhudi Kilimo is giving to farmers.

loans.use: to purchase a chaff cutter to prepare feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 24 years old, single, and has one child.  She is a farmer in Nkubu,  Kenya, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She raises cash crops and cereals, which she sells at the local market in her area.

Fridah is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES, which she will use to purchase a water tank that will assist her in conserving enough water to irrigate her crops when there is no rainfall.  This loan will help to increase her produce and income after selling her products.   Fridah will be able to improve her livelihood and pay school fees for her child.  Poor climatic conditions, poor markets, and lack of capital are her major challenges in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is married and works hard to support her family. She has a fish selling business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 10 years.

Marcela is requesting a loan from NWTF for 22,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.  In the future, Marcela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Qamile

texts.en:
Qamile is a lady from the vulnerable Egyptian community of south central Albania and she is married. She has grandchildren whom she adores, especially the little granddaughter photographed with her and her husband, Ferit.

Qamile has been working as a dressmaker for the past 20 years, not only for her community but for other communities as well. In addition to this activity, her husband sells used clothes in the market. The income they both generate is not bad at all, Ferit said; they even help their children.

Qamile and Ferit now want to buy a washing machine and for this they need some 50,000 Albanian Lek. This will be a tremendous help to them since they raise their grandchildren themselves and of course there is so much laundry to do.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is married and has 5 children. She is 53 years old and lives in Znac, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Concepcion sells food for snacks to earn a living and has this business for 7 years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

Concepcion has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Concepcion hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Namhia

texts.en:
Namhia is 50 years old and lives with her youngest son in a house in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. Her older children got married and moved out from her house. Her youngest son, Puntsag, age 15, is a secondary school student. 

She has been operating a grocery store business at a rental counter of the local market since 2010. Her business is now stable and she has built strong relationships with customers and suppliers over the last two years. 

She is now expanding her product range into dairy products and she is also starting to produce organic dried curds to sell at her counter. She needs additional investment of 5,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to increase her sales during winter and spring, which lack in supply of dairy products. She is a diligent and hardworking person who says, "I want my son to graduate university with better education."

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic milk and dairy products to increase her sales during winter and spring, which lack in supply of dairy products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 29 years old and a divorced Roma woman who suffered in her marriage, according to her. After her divorce about two years ago, she switched her focus on herself and has been feeling happier since. She started buying and selling used clothes in the city where she resides at the local market of the Roma community.

According to Alma, she has been doing well and has made a good income. She now wants to stock up on more quality items and this is the reason why she needs this loan which would be her first one.

Alma’s longer term goals include getting remarried, having children and opening a store to sell. But for now she is okay with what she’s been doing.

loans.use: To stock up on quality used clothes and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is from the village of Eniseli in East Georgia. She is 42 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law, and 22-year-old son. Alina’s husband works locally as an artisan, and he has a monthly income. Her mother-in-law receives a retirement pension. Alina runs a small dairy farm, consisting of a milk cow and two calves. She milks the cow and produces cheese with the milk. Besides her agricultural activities, Alina works as a baker at the local bakery to earn a monthly salary. She works hard to save and improve her family’s living conditions. 
Alina wants to make some repairs and improvements to her old house, but she does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of house repairs, such as changing windows, painting, etc. This loan will enable Alina and her family to have suitable living conditions and to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her old house so that she and her family will have a suitable place to live and enjoy living in their house.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is from Prenza, Tangub City.  She is 36 years old and married, with 5 children.  Maria cultivates bananas to earn an income for her family.  Maria has had her business for more than 6 years and earns 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month.  Maria joined GDMPC in 2011.  She is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is married and has four children. Elona is 39 years old and resides at Labuyo, Tangub City. 

Elona plants and harvests corn that she sells to the local community to earn a living, and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP. 

She requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

In 2010, Elona joined GDMPC. In the future, Elona wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 28-year-old gentleman who supports his schooling siblings. He is a livestock trader in Nkareta area and has been running the business for the past three years, making a monthly income of KES 20,000

He has borrowed his fifth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET Ltd., with which he intends to purchase more livestock for resale. 

The anticipated profit will be reinvested to boost business. His future dream is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en: Mgeni is 38 years old, married and the mother of three children who range in age from 3 years to 7 years old. She describes herself as a business-oriented woman, and earns a living by operating a stall where she sells food, snacks and tea. She has been in this business for five years, and works in a very busy area making sales mostly to people who live nearby. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use this loan, which is for Kes 20,000, to buy ingredients she needs to prepare foods for sale. Her goal is to improve her business within five years. In the future, she hopes to run a large hotel.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials to make handicraft decorations.

loans.name: Arnie

texts.en:
Arnie is 29 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Poblacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay.  Arnie works in the fish industry, buying and selling fish for a living, which she has been doing for five years. 

Arnie is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more fish to sell.  She has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Arnie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en: Genalyn is from Maquilao, Tangub City. She is 37 years old. Genalyn is married and has 3 children. She sells fish while her husband does fishing. She has been in business for 15 years and earns 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. In 2009, Genalyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new hooks & nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Uwezo Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kadagoyi, leader du groupe d’affaire «Uwezo», est un ancien entrepreneur, âgée de 49 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants qui étudient, cependant difficilement. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est vendeuse de souliers. Il y a 11 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus. Elle a reçu son premier capital de la part de son mari. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 4eme crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 25 paires de souliers. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir confortablement et ouvrir une boutique. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Kadagoyi, age 49, is the leader of the business group Uwezo and a long-time entrepreneur. She is a married mother of four children who attend school, albeit with some difficulty. Her husband is unemployed. She sells shoes, and has been engaged in small-scale income-generating activities for the past 11 years. She originally received her starting capital from her husband. 

She has just obtained a fourth loan from Hekima. She will use this new credit to buy 25 pairs of shoes.  

She wants to provide her children with a comfortable upbringing, and she would like to open a store. She wishes to thank Hekima for helping impoverished women who do not have access to traditional banking channels.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: 3.11.202.thiệu Ngọc Group

texts.en:
Thủy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thủy is 39 years old and is married with three children. One of her children is grown up so Thủy supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. One of the most critical business challenges that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In 2010, Thủy joined Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 3.11.202.thiệu Ngọc solidarity group, which consists of seven members.

With her business profits, Thủy hopes to maintain a successful business, for the business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: 3.14.199.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Phong works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

Phong is 56 years old and married with one child. Her child is grown up, so Phong supports no dependents with her business, which is in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Phong is the group leader of the 3.14.199.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2011, Phong joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Phong hopes to maintain a successful business. She also hopes for her child to find a good job and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and to sell in the future.

loans.name: 3.14.200.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Dân has a service business in clothing sales. She has been involved in this business for five years and is requesting a loan to purchase clothes to resell. She is 35 years old and married with two children.

Dân is the group leader of the 3.14.200.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She supports two dependents with her business, located in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Dân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Dân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to build a new house and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: 06.08.01 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling incense and ghost money. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make these votive objects to resell.

Thủy is 48 years old, married and has two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 06.08.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa, a city in Thanh Hoa province. One of her children is a dependent and one child is grown up. In 2010, Thủy joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main challenge that Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit Thủy hopes that she can help her children find good jobs, that her business will do well, and that her family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase material to make votive objects to resell.

loans.name: 03-01-03-Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Ms. Dẻo operates a food stall/restaurant selling prepared food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork and other ingredients to prepare food to sell. Dẻo has been involved in this business for four years.

Dẻo is 56 years old and is single with one child. Her child is grown up so Dẻo supports no dependents in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Dẻo is the group leader of the 03-01-03-Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. The main harship that Dẻo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Dẻo hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: To buy the rice and meat to prepare for sale, as well as to buy vegetables, fruits, dried goods on sale.
